His eight-year-old daughter Sansarmaa and six-year-old daughter Sansarbayar, study at the local primary school, while their younger daughter Sarangua, aged three, goes to the local kindergarten. 

Amgalantor has been running his taxi service business in town since 2009. He has been driving for more than 10 years and he is well-known for his safe and qualified service among customers. He is now requesting 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase a second hand eco-friendly electric and gas-powered car for his taxi service because his car is very old and needs replacement as it breaks down all the time. He is a hardworking and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase a second hand eco-friendly electric and gas-powered car for his taxi business

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
El comité ´´San Sebastián” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes. La Sra. Adolfina se dedica a la producción de queso que luego sale a vender en su comunidad, tiene muy buena clientela ya que siempre da productos muy buenos, y que son pedidos por muchos de sus clientes. tiene gran éxito debido a que es una persona muy buena en lo que hace y que gusta mucho a los clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo sus quesos y así seguir obteniendo los medios para seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Sebastián" was formed by the union of a number of neighbors from the city of Santaní. All the members of the group are developing independent businesses.

Señora Adolfina makes cheese that she later goes out to sell in her community. She has very good customers, since she always makes products that are very good and that are ordered by many of her customers. She has great success due to the fact that she is very good at what she does and the customers like her a lot. She is applying for this loan to purchase supplies to continue making her cheeses and thus continue obtaining the means to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make cheese.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité Emprendedoras  se encuentra en el 2º ciclo es de la ciudad de Santaní y está integrado por 13 señoras. La Señora Elvira, una de las integrantes se dedica a la venta de comidas su local se encuentra en un lugar estratégico que le permite tener una mayor cantidad de clientes y así a toda su familia se mantiene.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de carnes, verduras, hortalizas, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende, ya que con esto ayuda a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan para tener una mejor vida a la que ella tuvo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Emprendedoras" (Entrepreneurs) is in its second loan cycle in the city of Santani. It consists of 13 women.

Señora Elvira, one of the members, sells food. Her business is located in a strategic place that allows her to have a larger number of customers, and thus she supports her whole family. She is applying for this loan to buy meat, greens, vegetables, condiments, and other supplies to be able to continue making the foods that she sells, since with this she helps her family and gives them everything that they need to have a better life that she had.

loans.use: to buy meats, greens, vegetables, condiments, and other supplies

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsetseg is a 45-year-old widow who lives with her sister and brother in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her sister, Oyunchimeg, age 37, and brother, Nergui, age 37, help her to grow and sell organic vegetables on their plot of land. She has been growing organic vegetables for years and stores them in their storage pit to sell during winter, when the price has raised to the highest level. She rents a counter in a local market and sells her organic vegetables. 

She is now requesting 6,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase soils, seeds and other necessary items for the next planting. She is a hardworking and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase soils, seeds and other necessary items for next plantation.

loans.name: Anhzaya

texts.en:
Mr. Anhzaya is 22 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife, Nyamchimeg, age 22, works at a local market as a saleswoman and has recently given birth to their daughter Misheel, age 1. She takes care of their daughters, including Anhdolgoon, age 2. 

He has been working in a local company since 2009 and grows organic vegetables on their plot of land to sell to local customers. He is now requesting 1,100,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase insulation material to install in their Ger in order to stay warm during winter. He is a hardworking and welcoming man.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material to install in their Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in order to stay warm during winter.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El comité ´´Kuña Kyrey” se formó con la unión de 10 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní, donde todas se dedican a la cría de animal y a la agricultura, algunas de ellas faenan sus chanchos y gallinas para luego  vender  en mercado de la ciudad, otras venden verduras y hortalizas.  Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
Nancy, la presidenta, se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, y solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, para poder seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The group “Kuña Kyrey” formed with the joining up of 10 women in the city of Santaní, where they all work raising animals and in agriculture. Some of them slaughter their pigs and chickens in order to sell them later at the market in the city; others sell vegetables and produce. The members form a very united group that is capable of carrying out activities together that strengthen their team spirit. 

Nancy, the president, works raising and selling animals. She is requesting this loan to invest it in the purchase of feed for her animals, in order to continue working and helping her family.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña Guapa” tiene 12 miembros, lleva este nombre el grupo ya que todas son muy trabajadoras y es eso lo que significa la frase kuña guapa.
Todas las miembros de este grupo son muy trabajadoras y han demostrado que con esfuerzo y ganas de salir adelante todo se puede. Fermina es la presidenta de este grupo, ella se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, y cuenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado pues es de tiempo completo. Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados y trigo para sus animales para poder tenerlos bien alimentados y seguir con sus trabajo.
texts.en:
The group “Kuña Guapa” has 12 members. The group took this name because all of them are very hardworking, and this is the meaning of the phrase “kuña guapa”. All the members of this group are very industrious, and they have demonstrated that with effort and a desire to get ahead, anything can be done. 

Fermina is the president of this group. She works raising and selling farm animals, and she says that this work is very demanding because it’s full-time. She is requesting this loan to invest it in the purchase of feed and wheat for her animals, in order to have them well-fed and continue with her work.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and wheat.

loans.name: Anhzaya

texts.en:
Mrs. Anhzaya is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and son in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Dorjsuren, age 33, works at a local private company as an assistant worker. Her son, Monhtemuulen, age 14, goes to a local school. 

She has been working as saleswoman in a local market for years, and now she is planning to start her own grocery store business in the spare room of her house. She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase starting inventory for her grocery store. She is a hardworking, welcoming and friendly woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her new grocery store business.

loans.name: Suhbat

texts.en:
Mr. Suhbat is 56 years old. He lives with his wife and daughter in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Dolgor, works at a local company. His youngest daughter, Mongontsooj, age 13, goes to a local school. His other six children have gotten married and live separately. 

He has been running a transportation service business since he graduated from a driver's course in 1975. He bought cattle and started producing organic dairy products and selling to local customers. He is now requesting 1,900,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase forage for his cattle to feed them during winter. He is a hardworking, responsible and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase forage for his cattle to feed them during winter.

loans.name: Monhbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Monhbayar is 42 years old. He lives with his wife and son in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife, Baasanhuu, runs a business of selling organic fruits and vegetables from a rental counter of a local market. His son, Monhbaatar, age 10, goes to a local school. 

He has been running a transportation service business since 2007. He is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables and fruits for his wife's business to sell during winter. He and his wife are hardworking and honest people.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables and fruits for his wife's business to sell during winter.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria comenta que gracias al crédito anterior que recibieron de Kiva pudieron dar mejores productos a sus clientes y pudieron crecer bastante, estan muy agradecidos por eso ayuda.
Hoy nuevamente se acercan para pedir otra ayuda, la cual quieren volver a invertir en su despensa para poder surtirla con mas productos y variedad de insumos, como ser bebidas, lácteos, verduras y demás insumos. Esta muy agradecida por la nueva oportunidad que recibe, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Maria says that thanks to the previous loan that she received from Kiva, they were able to provide better products to their customers, and they were able to grow sufficiently. They are very grateful for this support.

Today they are once again interested in asking for further assistance. They want to invest again in their store to be able to stock it with more products and a variety of supplies such as beverages, dairy products, vegetables, and other supplies. She is very grateful for the new opportunity that she's receiving since it will a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products, vegetables, and other goods.

loans.name: Gansuvd

texts.en: Mrs Gansuvd is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in an apartment in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband Enh-Otgon, age 27, works as a computer repairman in a local company. Her  13-year-old daughter, Binderiya, goes to a local school. The couple also have a 10-month-old son, Anar, and so Gansuvd stays stays at home to take care of him. Her husband is planning to start his own computer service business in a rental office. Thus, Gansuvd is requesting 3,900,000 Mongolial tugriks (MNT) to purchase a scanner, a printer and other equipment to start his business. Her husband is a hardworking, well-experienced man who says: "We have a new born baby and our family expenses have increased a lot and I need to take care of my family".

loans.use: to purchase a scanner, printer and other equipment so that her husband can start a new computer service business

loans.name: Arslanbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Arslanbaatar is 26 years old. He lives with his parents and sisters in his parents' house in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His parents used to work at a state-owned meat-production company for years, and are now retired and stay home. His sisters work in local companies as an accountant and an assistant worker. 

He has worked at a local company as an accountant since 2009, right after he graduated from his bachelor's-degree program. He also runs an organic meat products business in a rental counter of a local market. His parents give lots of the necessary suggestions, and he is running his organic meat products sales business successfully. He is well-known with his qualified and tasty organic meat products. 

He is now requesting 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase inventory to run his organic meat products business smoothly. He is a hardworking and modest man who says, "I need to save to marry my girlfriend and move out of my parents' house; also, my parents' pension is not that much so I need to cover their living expenses, too."

loans.use: to purchase inventory to run his organic meat products business smoothly.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren is a 59-year-old widow who lives with her son and his girlfriend in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her son Dovdondorj, age 27, runs a taxi service business and helps his mother to run her organic vegetable business during his free-time. 

The borrower has been running a business selling organic vegetables in a rental counter of a local market since 2002. She has built close relationships with suppliers and customers over the years. She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase organic vegetables in large quantity and sell during the winter. She is a hardworking, welcoming, and kind woman.

loans.use: to purchase organic vegetables in large quantity and sell during winter.

loans.name: Nyamaa

texts.en:
Mr. Nyamaa is 28 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Tsugjargal, has given birth to their younger son, Bayanmonh, age 1, and stays home taking care of the newborn baby. His daughter, Enhbolor, age 7, goes to a local school, and son, Erhembayar, age 5, goes to a local kindergarten. 

He has been selling running shoes from a rental counter of a local market since 2009. His wife is planning to start her own business of a butcher shop at a rental counter of a local market since they are having a newborn baby and the family expenses increased a lot. 

He is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase starting inventory for his wife's newly starting butcher shop business. He and his wife both are hardworking, optimistic and welcoming people.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for his wife's newly started butcher shop business.

loans.name: Chimgee

texts.en:
Chimgee is a 52-year-old widow who lives with her son in a ger in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her son Buyanjargal, age 25, works at a police department as a psychologist. 

The borrower has been running a general store in a rental counter of a local market since 2003. She purchases inventory from a wholesaler, transports it with her car, and sells it to the local customers at a retail price. Her car has not been running for a while and she needs a replacement in order to run her business smoothly. 

She is now requesting 2,200,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to run her business. She is a hardworking, open-minded woman.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to run her business.

loans.name: Tsolmon

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsolmon is a 53-year-old widow who lives with her son in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her youngest son, Hadbaatar, age 27, works as a driver in a local company. Her daughter has married and lives separately. 

She has been running a barber shop in a rental place for 28 years, and her daughter works with her, too. She has built close relationships with customers and already has a regular customer base. 

She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase a vehicle for her son to start his transportation business. She and her children are hardworking, responsible and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle for her son to start his transportation business.

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenetsogt is 50 years old and lives with his daughter in a small house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His daughter, Nandin-Erdene, age 10, goes to a local school. 

He has been working in a private company for years and started his own business of handcrafts by customer order at home. His wife has left him, and he needs to take care of his daughter so he quit the job and stays home running his handcraft business. He has just built a small house for his family and is now requesting 700,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase insulation material to install in his new house in order to stay warm during winter. He is a hardworking, reliable and honest man.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material to install in his new house in order to stay warm during winter.

loans.name: Monhtsetseg

texts.en: Mrs Monhtsetseg is a 30-year-old female head of the family who lives with her three children in Ger, in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her 9-year-old daughter, Anudari, goes to a local primary school and her 5-year-old duaghter, Anuzaya, goes to a local kindergarten. Monhtsetseg gave birth to her son, Saruulbayar, just 3 months ago. She has been running a clothing sales business since 2009. However, her business is temporarily on hold because of her pregnancy leave and maternity leave. She is now requesting 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase new clothing to restart her business in order to cover her family's expenses. As she has a new baby, her family expenses have increased. She is a hardworking, positive woman.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing to restart her clothing sales business following the birth of her son

loans.name: Davaadagva

texts.en: Davaadagva is 59 years old and lives with his wife in a small house in the Orhon province of Mongolia. His wife, Oyungerel, is 59 years old and retired. His adult children are married and live separately. Davaadagva has been running a taxi business in town since 2000. His car has broken down several times recently and he needs a replacement to run his business. He is now planning to replace his car with a better van. He is requesting a loan of 1700000 MNT to pay for the van which he will use to provide public transportation in town. He is a hardworking, experienced driver.

loans.use: to buy a replacement motor vehicle for his business

loans.name: Horolmaa

texts.en: Mrs.Horolmaa is 27 years old and lives with her husband and 2 daughters in a Ger, in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Lhagvasuren has worked at a local company for years. Her daughters Monhzul, age 5 and Monhgerel, age 2, go to local kindergarten. Horolmaa has been staying home since she gave birth to her daughters and now she is planning to start her own business of clothing sales. She used to work at the local market as a saleswoman and she has a lot of experience in the field. She is now requesting 1'500'000MNT to purchase a starting inventory for her new clothing sales business. She is a hardworking, optimistic and kind woman.

loans.use: to purchase a starting inventory for her new clothing sales business

loans.name: Taher

texts.en: Taher is 29 years old and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a hardworking man who works hard to achieve a better life. He works for the General Authority for Roads, on a low income. Taher built a small house from hard-earned money, but he is suffering from a lack of money to furnish his house. He asked his friends and relatives to lend him money, but no one helped him. So, he has applied for a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture for his house. He wishes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy furniture to use for his house.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en: Osama is a 28-year-old married man with two children, from Taiz,Yemen. He has a diploma certificate. Osama works in a Yemen Company for Packaging Material Industry. His income is really not enough to cover all living expenses: food, rent, clothes,etc. He is hardworking and wants to start up a small business to help him pay for all his family life expenses. Osama decided to apply for a Youth loan of 100.00 YER from AMB to purchase mobile phone recharge cards for resale. He is sure that this would help him to provide much better living standards for his family. Osama looks forward to opening a mobile accessories store and building his own house when he has accumulated a good sum of money.

loans.use: to pay for buying mobile phone recharge cards for resale

loans.name: Shahira Group

texts.en:
This group has three members, all of whom work in a small business. The women feel very excited by the mutual support among them, which is constant and above all inspires them with the will to continue striving for their families. Their work as a team and utilizing all their available resources makes their efforts their greatest strength.

Fatima is a street vendor, and through her selfless work she is raising her family. She has been selling perfumes and ladies clothes. She defines herself as a very hard-working person who does not fear challenges and dares to do anything to help her family. She is applying for a youth loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy items including perfumes and ladies clothes to resell and thus continue improving her life and that of her family.

loans.use: buy items including perfumes and ladies clothes to resell

loans.name: San Miguel Arcangel Group

texts.es:
El comité "San Miguel Arcángel"se originó a través de promociones  que se hicieron en el barrio.Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio.El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La sra Isidora, es Presidenta del grupo, ella Trabaja en la venta de chipa (alimento típico paraguayo) que a diario sale a vender por el barrio, su deseo es seguir progresando y que el grupo se vaya fortaleciendo cada día más, manifiesta que se siente muy a gusto en su comité y espera muchos beneficio más, ella pondrá el mayor de su esfuerzo para que su comité surja  y salga adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de chipa, las cuales podrá vender y seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The "San Miguel Arcángel" group was set up through the promotions that were carried out in their town. All the members are from the same area, they known each other and are neighbours. The objective of each member is to work, create a communal spirit and to reach the top level of the programme.

Isidora is President of the group, she sells Chipa for a living, which is a typical Paraguayan food. Everyday she goes out to sell it around the town. Her wish is to continue progressing and for the group to get stronger everyday. She states that she feels very comfortable in the group and hopes to benefit more. She will put her greatest effort into ensuring that the group does well.

She is asking for this loan to invest it in the purchase of Chipa, which she can then sell and continue working as before.

loans.use: to buy Chipa to sell.

loans.name: Niño Jesus 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la cuidad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación,  trabajan todas muy unidas y se encuentran  en el 4to ciclo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Ana, ella tiene su propia despensa en su casa, es soltera, tiene 1 hijo. Ana cuenta que todo el sacrificio que hace es por su hijo, para poder darle todo lo que se merece y que no tenga que pasar por ninguna privación, ya que por el lucha incansablemente.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser carne, verduras, bebidas, hortalizas y demás
texts.en:
This group, from the city of Encarnación was set up because of contact with one of the foundation's members. They are very united and are in their 4th cycle.

One of the members of the group is Ana, she has her own store at home and has a son. Ana tells us that all her sacrifices have been for her son, to be able to give him everything he deserves and not have him want for anything. She struggles tirelessly for him.

She is requesting this loan to buy stock for her store, like meat, vegetables, drinks and others.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, drinks and other things

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Este comité está en su primer ciclo, y las miembros están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y a ayudarse las unas a las otras para poder salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Rosalina, ella tiene su propia despensa, es soltera, tiene 4  hijos. Cuenta la Sra. Rosalina que con mucho esfuerzo está sacando adelante a sus hijos, ya que ella no recibe ayuda de nadie, es una persona que pese a muchos contratiempos ha podido salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, hortalizas, carne y demás insumos para poder seguir teniendo su negocio bien surtido.
texts.en:
This group is in its first cycle and the members are learning to work together and help each other to succeed by working as a unit.

One of the group members is Rosalina, she has her own store, is single and has four children. Rosalina tells us that a lot of her effort is to support her children as she does not receive help from anyone. She is a person who, despite many setbacks, has managed to get by.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in stock for her store like vegetables, meat and other products so she can continue running a well-stocked business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat and other things

loans.name: Kuña Pora 1 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la cuidad de encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación,  trabajan con la Fundación desde el año 2006,  se encuentran  en el 23° ciclo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Miriam, quien es costurera, quien tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde trabaja todos los días arduamente, siempre esta cargada de muchos pedidos y trabajo y con eso es que ayuda a su familia y esta saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos para poder cumplir con pedidos que tiene. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe y cuenta que su sueño es poder agrandar su taller y dar trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación was set up after contact with one of the Foundation's members. They have been working with the Foundation since 2006 and are now in their 23rd cycle.

One of the group members is Miriam, she is a seamstress and has a little sewing workshop where she works hard everyday. She always has lots of orders and work and she uses this to support her family and is doing well.

She is asking for this loan to invest it by buying fabric and threads to fulfil her current orders. She is grateful for the opportunity she receives and tells us that her greatest wish is to expand her workshop and employ others.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo esta en su ciclo numero doce, y con mucho sacrificio y trabajo en conjunto están pudiendo salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra Florinda ella tiene su propio Kiosko , tienen 3 hijos está casada con el señor Roberto que trabaja en una empresa, todos viven en su casa de la ciudad de Encarnación.
Florinda cuenta que tiene muy buena venta y que siempre tiene muy bien surtido su negocio y que por eso le va bien, solicita de este crédito para comprar golosinas, comestibles, bebidas y demás insumos para poder seguir surtiendo su negocio.
texts.en:
This group is in its 12th cycle and with a lot of sacrifice and team work they are succeeding and helping each other.

One of the group members is Florinda, who runs her own Kiosk. She has three children and is married to Roberto who works in a business. They all live in their home in the city of Encarnación.

Florinda tells us that her products are selling well and that she always keeps her business well-stocked, so it is going well. She is asking for this loan to buy sweets, snacks, drinks and other products to be able to continue stocking her business.

loans.use: to buy sweets, snacks, drinks and other things.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Las Emprendedoras es un grupo muy activo, y a pesar de tener algunos inconvenientes dentro del comité siempre supieron salir adelante, el grupo se encuentra en el ciclo 13º , en estos momentos estan teniendo sus  ahorros y caja chica que les facilitaran el retiro del próximo crédito.
La Sra. Angela es la presidenta del grupo , y siempre sabe  llevar bien adelante su puesto ya que es muy estricta y a la vez comprensiva, ella es comerciante tiene despensa y también trabaja haciendo comidas para empleados de una empresa,  con el correr del tiempo ella quiere que crezca su  negocio y poner otras cosas mas con lo que ya tiene.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su despensa y también de productos para elaborar las comidas que vende.
texts.en:
The "Las Emprendedoras" group is a very active group. Despite having some setbacks within the group they always know how to succeed. The group is on its 13th loan, at the moment they are saving their money and each girl will be able to retire after the next loan.

Angela is the group President and always knows how to make the most of her position as she is very strict and understanding at the same time. She is a saleswoman who has her own store and also makes food for the employees of a local business. With the passing of time she would like to grow her business and offer other products and services alongside her current range.

She is requesting this loan to buy stock for her store and ingredients to make the foods that she sells.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store and also ingredients to make food that she sells.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El progreso se denomina excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá , gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Ada que se dedica a la venta de empanadas contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 14 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en el 4° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Ada cuenta por su parte que el grupo la ha ayudado a crecer y que le esta yendo bien, siempre vende muchas empanadas, ya que son muy ricas, la meta que tiene es poder abrir un gran local algún día.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus empanadas, como ser carne, condimentos, verduras y demás.
texts.en:
"El Progreso" is the name of an excellent group of women set up in the city of Itá thanks to the current Director General, Ada, who sells empanadas, as she contacted an assessor at a weekly meeting in their area to inform them of the formation of the group as a Communal Bank. Once they had been assessed, she joined the programme with 14 women who find themselves working very well in the their 4th cycle as a unit within the programme.

Ada tells us that the group has helped her to grow and that she is doing well. She always sells lots of empanadas, as they are delicious. Her goal is to be able to open a big store one day.

She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients so she can continue making empanadas, such as meat, condiments, vegetables and other things.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables and other things.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Rory, se conformó en fecha 22 de octubre del 2010, gracias a que la Directora General, la Sra. Felicia, quien recibió un afiche de promoción del programa, y quedo muy interesada, logro convencer a sus vecinas y contaron con la asesora para la conformación del comité que la actualidad está conformada por 21 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto  en el  6° ciclo.
La Sra. Felicia se dedica a las ventas ya que tiene una librería y también se dedica a la venta de ropas, es una señora muy trabajadora que desea salir adelante y se esfuerza por salir adelante, realmente es un gran ejemplo a seguir.
Solicita de este crédito para pode invertirlo en la compra de libros, cuadernos, lápices, marcadores y demás insumos para poder surtir su librería y así seguir dando a sus clientes la variedad a la que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
The women's Communal Bank named "Kuña Rory", was set up on October 22, 2012 thanks to the Director General, Felicia, who received a promotional flyer from the programme. She was very interested and managed to convince her neighbours and they contacted an assessor to create the Communal Bank, which is currently made up of 21 women who are working well in their 6th cycle. 

Felicia is a saleswoman as she owns a bookstore and occasionally sells clothes.She is a hard-working woman and wants to succeed, so she works very hard and is a great example for people to follow.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in books, notepads, pencils, markers and other products to be able to stock her bookshop and continue giving her customers the variety that they are used to.

loans.use: to buy books, notepads, pencils, markers and other things

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el 12º ciclo con 11 integrantes, son señoras trabajadoras que luchan en salir adelante en invertir el crédito en sus respectivas actividades ya sea en la venta de ropas y en la venta de comestibles. Todas realizan actividades independientes, con ganas de superación y empeño.
La Sra. Agueda se dedica a la venta de chipa (Alimento típico paraguayo como el pan) y comenta que le está yendo muy bien ya que la chipa siempre se vende mucho en cualquier época del año. Se define a sí misma como una persona muy trabajadora y con ansias de luchar y salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar más chipas para la venta y así ofrecer excelente variedad a sus clientes
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is currently in the 12th cycle with 11 members, they are hard-working women who work hard to succeed and invest their loan in their respective businesses, which include the sale of clothes and food. They all have their own businesses with desires to work hard and succeed.

Agueda sells chipa (a typical Paraguayan food similar to bread) and comments that she is doing well as chipa always sells well throughout the year. She describes herself as a hard-working person with ambitions to work hard and succeed.

She is asking for this loan to buy more chipas to sell so she can offer her customers plenty of variety.

loans.use: to buy chipa to sell.

loans.name: Palmira

texts.es:
La  Señora Palmira tiene 36 años de edad, es  madre soltera y vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá. Esta señora es hija de una conocida artesana de la zona, ella desde muy pequeña empezó a trabajar con su madre en el negocio, y con la ayuda de la misma logró montar su propio negocio que es la  venta de sobrecamas y hamacas. Actualmente ya tiene clientela formada en la zona y así aumenta cada vez más su pedido de mercaderías. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ya pudo construirse una pequeña casita.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilo, color y otros que en esta temporada le solicitan mucho sus clientes.
texts.en:
Palmira, 36, is a single mother and lives in the city of Carapeguá. She is the daughter of a well-known craftswoman in the area and has worked with her mother in the business since she was a child. With her help she has set up her own business selling bedcovers and hammocks. 

She currently has a customer base in the area and the orders she receives for her merchandise is constantly increasing. Thanks to her hard-work and dedication she has been able to build herself a little house.

She is asking for this loan to buy thread, dye and other products that her customers are requesting this season.

loans.use: to buy thread, dye and other things.

loans.name: Om-Wael Group

texts.en:
Om-Wael group consists of four women from Taiz, Yemen. They have applied for a youth loan of 80,000 Yemeni rials (YER) from AMB in order to buy home appliances.

Samira is a 24-year-old newly-married woman. She has an elementary school education and is a housewife. She lives with her husband in a small apartment. Her husband does not earn too much and cannot afford to buy most home appliances. Most of his monthly income goes to paying for rent and food. Samira loves her husband and wants to help him as much as she can, so she has applied for a youth loan of 20,000 YER to purchase some appliances. Samira looks forwards to standing beside her husband and helping him to pay for all their living expenses.

loans.use: buy home appliances

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha is a 37-year-old single woman. She works in data base entry and receives a low salary which is not enough to cover all her needs. Suha's father receives a low pension and lives with his family in a modest old house that needs some repairs.

 Suha wants to contribute to some of the repair costs so she is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of installing new aluminum windows at her family's house.

 This will improve the family's living conditions at home, especially during the winter season.

 Suha appears in the photo.

loans.use: to install new windows at her house

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en:
Yazan is a 27-year-old married man and a father to two sons. Yazan is employed and receives a low salary which is not enough to cover all of his family's needs. 

For the past three years Yazan has been driving a taxi which has been a profitable project and a second source of income for the family. 
Yazan is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new engine for the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours and enable Yazan to take additional internal and external requests which will improve the family's income.
 
Yazan is photographed inside his taxi.

loans.use: to install a new engine in his taxi

loans.name: Sazan's Group

texts.en:
Sazan is a 26-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of one. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Sazan is one of many Iraqi women who work from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Sazan has been working on her old sewing machine for three years in her small, home-based sewing and tailoring business. To keep the work more fun members of this group often work together at each other's houses.

Sazan proudly showed her dressed to the MFI staff visiting her, and she clearly enjoys making custom order dresses and other small fabric household items. She would like to improve her work and replace her simple old sewing machine with a newer model which will allow her to be faster and more creative in her work. To make the purchase Sazan took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor, thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to replace her simple old machine a with a newer model

loans.name: Zhian

texts.en:
Zhian is a young, shy, Iraqi woman. She is 28 years old, married and a mother of two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Zhian is one of many Iraqi women who work from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Zhian has been using her sewing skills for four years to help the family's income, working from home with a small sewing and tailoring business. Zhian works with an old sewing machine, making custom order dresses and other small fabric household items.

She would like to buy an over-machine and create a better work area for herself as she currently works in a small corner space in the children's room. To pay for these items she took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq.

Zhian is under 30, and as such qualifies for a youth loan.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for her protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy an over-machine and create a better work area for herself

loans.name: Saed

texts.en:
Saed is a single young Palestinian man who works with his family in agriculture, planting different types of vegetables inside greenhouses.

 Saed is a very ambitious young man and likes the independence of working without others, so for the past year Saed has had his own greenhouse. This has been a profitable project to him but it needs more support to cover some necessary costs.

 Saed is requesting a 500 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing tomato seedlings. It will allow Saed to produce a better crop and thus increase his sales and improve the family's income.

 Saed is photographed inside his greenhouse.

loans.use: to purchase tomato seedlings

loans.name: Talar

texts.en:
Talar is a 19-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of one. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Talar is one of many Iraqi women who work from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Talar has two years' experience with her small, home-based sewing and tailoring business and she enjoys making custom order dresses and other small fabric household items. She would like to improve her work area by creating a bigger space and would like to decorate it with creative and useful items to help her customers and herself think more creatively about their sewing projects.

To pay for the improvement works Talar took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 2400 USD.

Talar is under 30 and as such qualifies for a youth loan.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for her protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve her work area by creating a bigger space and by decorating it

loans.name: Al-Ghadri Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Ghadri and consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen.

 Samira is a 30-year-old woman. She is employed but receives a low salary which is not enough to cover all her family's needs. She wants to improve her family’s living conditions. Every three days she goes to the laundry to wash her clothes due to a lack of money to buy a washing machine. She is requesting a youth loan from AMB to assist with purchasing necessary home appliances such as a washing machine.

Taking this loan will enable her and her family to live in an easy way in their house and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: purchase necessary home appliances such as a washing machine.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami, age and 18 and unmarried, opened his cosmetics and accessories store two years ago. His start-up capital came from money he had accumulated from his previous job and the help of his mother. He helped his father and uncle paint houses while he was still a student. Sami is from Sana'a and is a secondary school graduate. He is a very hard-working young man.

Sami would like to buy more products that are in high customer demand, so he has applied for a youth loan in the amount of 100.000 YER from AMB. 

Sami hopes to earn a considerable profit, which he intends to put into savings so that he can eventually have enough to go to university, take the TOEFL test, and get married.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, accessories, and other products to offer for sale in his store

loans.name: Hazha

texts.en:
Hazha is a 27-year-old married Iraqi woman. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Hazha is one of many Iraqi women who work from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has a small, home-based sewing and tailoring business which she would like to expand to better meet her customers' needs. She would like to buy an over machine, a chair and table for her sewing machine, an iron, tools, quality raw materials and fabrics.

To make these purchases she took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 1500 USD.

Hazha is under 30 and as such qualifies for a youth loan.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for her protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy an over machine, a chair and table for her sewing machine, an iron, tools, quality raw materials and fabrics

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama, age 24 and unmarried, earns an income from driving a minibus. He started in this business by working in a friend's bus for a monthly salary, and after a few years he was able to buy a used minibus of his own. He is from Al-Hodeidah and is a secondary school graduate. He is an industrious man. 

At present, Osama's minibus is in need of essential repairs and maintenance. Osama has therefore applied for a youth loan in the amount of 100.000 YER to repair his vehicle.

He hopes that he will be able to buy a new minibus in a few years.

loans.use: To pay for essential repairs and maintenance on his minibus

loans.name: Anhzaya

texts.en:
Anhzaya, age 27, has worked as a saleswoman since 2000. She now wishes to open her own retail sales clothing business at the local market. She lives with her husband and two sons in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Mandah runs a small Internet cafe in their neighborhood. Their son Orgil, age 8, goes to the local primary school, and their younger son Javhlan attends the local kindergarten. 

Anhzaya has gained lot of experience and has established a strong network over the years. She is confident that her new business will be a success. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,180,000 MNT in order to purchase a starting inventory for her new clothing retail venture. 

She is a hard-working, optimistic, and honest woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her new clothing retail business

loans.name: Tseveendulam

texts.en: Mrs.Tseveendulam is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a small house in Bayanhoshuu District of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Erdenebat, age 52, works as a guardsman for a local private company. Her daughters, Oyun-Erdene, age 15, and Tseyenbadam, age 13, go to a local secondary school. The borrower has been running her tailoring service business at her home, getting orders from local customers, for over 10 years. She is now planning to build a small place in their plot of land right next to their house to run her business. She is now requesting 3,000,000 tugriks to purchase inventory and construction materials to build a workplace for her business. She is a hardworking, diligent and well experienced woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and construction materials to build a workplace for her tailoring business

loans.name: Sainbayar

texts.en: Mr. Sainbayar is 24 years old and lives with his wife in Ger in Bayanhoshuu Province of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Undrah, studies at university. This borrower has been running a taxi service business in town and inter-city for four years. He is a well experienced and hardworking man. He is now requesting a 3,000,000 tugrik loan to pay for his wife's university tuition fees and other school-related expenses.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's university tuition fees and other school-related expenses

loans.name: Lhaijav

texts.en: Lhaijav is 46 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a ger in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Dolgorjav, age 40, helps her husband to run their business of producing organic dairy products and selling them in town. His son Hishigtogtoh, age 19, and daughter Davaajargal, age 17, study at university, while son Tserentogtoh, age 8, goes to a local school and youngest daughter Buyandelger, age 3, goes to a local kindergarten. Lhaijav has been running his business of producing and selling organic dairy products for two years. He sells his organic dairy products to local retailers and delivers the products to them with his mini truck. He needed a replacement for his truck and is now requesting 4,500,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming vehicle to run his business smoothly without any sudden stopping. He is a hardworking, diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming vehicle to run his business smoothly without any sudden stopping

loans.name: Khader

texts.en:
Khader is a 28-year-old married man. He is employed in a local restaurant, and his low salary barely covers his family's needs.

Khader wants to create better living conditions for the family, so he is now building a new house (see photo). He is, however, short of some construction supplies and is requesting a youth loan of $2,000 USD from Kiva’s partner Palestine for Credit and Development. 

The loan will cover the cost of purchasing iron, concrete and wood. This will help Khader finish his house so that he and his family can enjoy living in it.

loans.use: To buy the construction supplies he needs to complete building his family's house

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en: Batbaatar is 43 years old and lives with his wife and and three sons in a ger in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His wife has been running a small tailoring service business at home. His sons Duisensangi, age 16, Bayarmagnai, age 14, and Bazarsad, age 10, go to local schools. Batbaatar has been working as a driver in a local private company for seven years. He has been fixing his and his colleagues' vehicles during his work. He has a lot of experience in fixing mini trucks, bigger trucks and vans. He is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase equipment and spare parts to start his own business of auto repair service on their plot of land. He is a hardworking, optimistic and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and spare parts to start his own business of auto repair service on their plot of land

loans.name: Javhaa

texts.en:
Mr. Javhaa is 44 years old and lives with his wife in a small house in the Nalaih district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Nyam, age 50, is retired and helps her husband to run his cobbler business in the spare room of their house. Javhaa’s three children all are married and live separately from them. 

Javhaa used to be a herder; then moved to the city and started his cobbler business in their spare room. He has built a close relationship with his customers and suppliers. He is now requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase a sewing machine and inventory to run his business smoothly and without sudden pause. 

Javhaa is a hardworking, diligent and honest man.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and inventory to run his business smoothly and without sudden pause.

loans.name: Enhtuvshin

texts.en:
Enhtuvshin is 46 years old and lives with her husband and son in a small house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband, who is also 46, works as a teacher at a local school. Her 16-year-old son goes to the local secondary school. Her older children are married and live separately. 

Enhtuvshin is a hardworking, responsible and welcoming woman. She has been running a business of growing and selling organic vegetables since 2005. She also purchases organic vegetables to produce canned products to sell to local customers. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Mongolian tughrik to purchase large amounts of organic vegetables to produce preserved products.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of organic vegetables to produce preserved products

loans.name: Yalaltbayar

texts.en: Yalaltbayar is 35 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a small house in Hentii province, Mongolia. His wife Soyolmaa, age 35, works in a local market as a saleswoman. His son, age 11, and daughter, age 7, go to the local school. Yalatbayar worked at a local wooden furniture manufacturing company for 5 years, but he quit because of a health condition that required him to stay at home to receive medications. He has now gotten well and is planning to start his own wooden furniture manufacturing business based on his years of experience and the network he has built over the years. Yalaltbayar is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase equipment, tools, and inventory to start his furniture-making business. He is a hardworking, positive, and honest man.

loans.use: to purchase equipment, tools, and inventory to start a wooden furniture manufacturing business

loans.name: Oyunbat

texts.en:
Mr. Oyunbat, 22 years old, lives with his wife and son in a ger, in Uvs province, Mongolia. His wife, Solongo, is a senior student at university and temporarily staying at home with her maternity leave. She has given birth to their son, Mongonbagana, 5 months old, and now is taking care of their newborn baby. 

Oyunbat has been working as a driver in a local company since 2011. He is now planning to provide taxi services independently, during his off-duty time, because they have a newborn baby and his wife has not graduated yet. He has family expenses to cover and needs to work more. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000MNT to purchase an eco-friendly, electric and gas consuming car, with which to provide taxi services. He is a hard-working, optimistic and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly, electric and gas consuming car, to provide taxi services during his time off from his regular job.

loans.name: Vuqar

texts.en:
Vuqar is a 44-year-old man.  He is an IDP who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. After several attempts to find a job he decided to start his own business. He is farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years.

He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy.  Many national dishes are made from vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on ever Azerbaijan family’s table and are also used to make fresh punch.

Vuqar sells his crops in the Bilasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise the crops.
As his products are in high demand, Vuqar wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1700 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his 3rd loan and he has positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy seeds, new garden tools and fertilizers for his seasonal fruit and vegetable crops.

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru:
Вера живет и работает в городе Запорожье. Она торгует детской одеждой на одном из местных рынков уже с 1996 года. У Веры есть свой собственный торговый прилавок. 
Вере понадобилась сумма в 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить детскую одежду для последующей реализации в зимнее время года, а именно детские брюки, костюмы, шапочки, футболки.  Закупив более качественный товар, Вера сможет расшириться и составить конкуренцию другим торговцам с той же группой товаров.
texts.en: Vera lives and works in the town of Zaporozhye. She  has been selling children’s clothing at one of the local markets since 1996. Vera has her own sales stand. Vera needs the sum of 5,000 UAH in order to stock up on children’s clothing to resell during the winter season: children’s pants, suits, hats, and T-shirts. By stocking up on higher-quality goods, Vera will be able to expand her business and compete successfully with other vendors specializing in the same type of merchandise.

loans.use: to stock up children’s pants, suits, hats, and T-shirts.

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина занимается выращиванием овощей на своем участке в селе Водяное. Этим бизнесом она занимается уже 10 лет. Ирина – разведена, сама воспитывает дочку. Из овощей она выращивает помидоры, редис и огурцы.  
Ирина надеется вложить сумму в 24 000 гривен в подготовку к новому фермерскому сезону, а именно купить семена, пленку, уголь и удобрения. В этом году Ирина решила сделать теплицы под две пленки и купить хорошие качественные семена, что значительно ускорит процесс созревания овощей и улучшит качество получаемой продукции. Еще Ирина в этом году купила участок в 6 соток, на котором она планирует строить дополнительные теплицы в ближайшем будущем.
texts.en:
Irina grows vegetables on her land plot in the village of Vodyanoe. She has been in this business for 10 years. Irina is divorced and bringing up a daughter on her own. She grows tomatoes, radishes and cucumbers. 

Irina hopes to invest 24,000 UAH to prepare for a new farming season, specifically to buy seeds, greenhouse film charcoal and fertilizers. This year Irina decided to insulate her greenhouses with double-layer film  and  buy high-quality seeds, which will speed up the ripening of the vegetables and improve the quality of her produce. In addition, this year Irina bought a land plot of 600 m (about 0.15 acres), where she plans to build additional greenhouses in the near future.

loans.use: to cover her greenhouses in double-layer film and buy high-quality seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase upholstery both for the canopy and for the seats of her vehicle.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is married with five children. She is 58 years old and lives in Tigdok, Tudela, Philippines. Alicia sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, soft drinks, detergents, etc. 

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Alicia hope to save for their personal consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, soft drinks, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Batbold

texts.en:
Mr. Batbold, 25 years old, lives with his wife and two-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on his father-in-law’s plot of land. The family’s main income is his photographic service. 

He has received loans from our organization twice and this time he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase equipment such as a printer, a computer, and a camera. As a result he can generate more income for his family as well as achieve consumer satisfaction.

loans.use: to purchase a printer, computer, and camera.

loans.name: Senia

texts.en:
This is Senia. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy more fish and, of course, sell more as well. This has been her business for ten years now, and it continues to grow. She sells six different kinds of fish. She and her husband are working hard to generate income for their family.

She would like to apply for another PHP 30,000 loan to pay for fish needed for her business. More items to sell will result in higher profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Senia hopes that her business will grow and dreams of providing a good education and future for her children. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of fish needed for her business.

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbold, 43 years old, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He and his wife work at the same business entity. He has been working there since 2010, while his wife recently began working there as a saleswoman, in November, 2012.

Enkhbold has gotten a loan from our organization before, and paid his debt on the established schedule. This time, he is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to spend for building an addition to his house. To build the addition, he needs to purchase construction materials, such as hardwood floors, roofing, cotton, bricks and cement. As a result, the family will live in a comfortable and spacious place. Especially at this time of year, construction materials are at their lowest prices, and he can save quite a large amount of money from this price discount. The borrower is a very hard-working individual, who is striving for a better future.

loans.use: to build a house addition

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarsaikhan, 55 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son got married and now lives separately from his parents. He and his wife reside in their own house on a plot of land. 

Since 1998, he has been running his spare parts sales business, and his wife assists him. He purchases old automobile spare parts in large quantities from Russia. Using the spare parts, he repairs old Russian automobiles which have deteriorated over the years. Then he sells those repaired automobiles to customers at higher prices. In general, Russian spare parts are expensive and that's why running an old spare parts sales business is profitable for him. 

The borrower Bayarsaikhan once received a loan from our organization and paid every installment on the established schedule. This time he is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to purchase an old russian automobile in order to repair it with his spare parts and later sell it at a higher price. As a result, he can generate more income for his family. He is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase an old russian automobile

loans.name: Evila

texts.es:
Evila, de 32 años, es una joven mujer trabajadora, convive con Augusto quien es el padre de sus 5 hijos, vive en su casa propia junto a toda su familia y su madre, ella trabaja mucho pues lo que más desea es poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños hijos y consolidarse económicamente. Evila, se dedica a la venta de pescado. Su horario de trabajo empieza en la madrugada, se dirige al puerto pesquero de la ciudad y ahí obtiene las especies de pescado que tienen mayor precio en el mercado, sus ventas son al por mayor pero para que pueda vender todo tiene que esforzarse mucho para atraer a sus clientes porque asegura que la competencia es muy fuerte. Empieza a trabajar a las 4 de la madrugada y termina a las 7 u 8 de la mañana. Luego se dirige a su casa a descansar y cumplir su rol de madre. Lleva en este negocio más de 5 años, trabaja sola y afirma que las ganas por hacer las cosas bien y generar ingresos económicos para su familia son su principal motivo para ir en busca del progreso.

Le gusta la libertad que le brinda este negocio ya que puede divertirse por las tardes jugando y practicando algún deporte además de estar al lado de su familia, espera seguir trabajando para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.
Este es el préstamo grupal número 3 con MFP, siempre fue muy buena socia dentro de su grupo en donde la quieren mucho por ser muy responsable y solidaria, agradece a quienes le brindan el préstamo que requiere para seguir incrementado su negocio, esta convencida que seguirá siendo una cliente muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como lo hizo en todos los préstamos que tuvo hasta ahora.
El monto solicitado (S/. 1000) lo invertirá en la compra de pescados de las mejores especies y tamaños.
texts.en:
Evila, 32, is a young, hard-working woman. She lives with Augusto, the father of her 5 children. She lives in her own house with her family and her mother.

She works hard, but the one thing she desires most is to give the best quality of life and the financial stability that she can to her children.

Evila works as a fish saleswoman. Her business hours begin early in the morning. She goes to the fisherman's port in the city. There, she gets the fish that have the highest market price. She sells the fish in bulk. However, in order to sell everything, she has to work very hard to attract customers because she says there is a lot of competition. 

She starts work at 4:00 in the morning and finishes at 7:00 or 8:00  in the morning. Later, she goes home to rest and fulfill her role as a mother. She has more than 5 years of experience in this business. She works alone and says that her will to do good things and generate income for her family are her main motivation for trying to get ahead. She likes the freedom that this business gives her because she can enjoy herself in the afternoons by playing or doing sports by her family's side. 

She hopes to continue working to continue growing her business. This is the 3rd loan with the group MFP. She has always been a good member of the group, and they like her a lot because she is responsible and supportive. She appreciates those who gave her the loan so she can continue to grow her business. 

She is convinced that she will continue to be punctual and will pay her installments on time, like she has on previous loans up until now. 

The amount she is requesting (1000  Soles) will be invested in buying the biggest and best species of fish.

loans.use: to buy the biggest and best species of fish.

loans.name: Marlito

texts.en:
This is Marlito, 56, resident of Intramuros, Philippines. He is a widower and father to his children. He and his children manage their household while operating a business. He is working hard to provide income for their everyday living.

Marlito operates a video/karaoke shop. He provides a place in his house to be used by customers who want to rent the video/karaoke machine. Customers can also rent the karaoke machine and bring it to their house for a higher rental fee. He also has a food stall. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, Marlito is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. He will be using the loan for the maintenance of his video/karaoke machine. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.

Marlito hopes that his children will finish their studies and dreams of expanding his business and having more businesses. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and work every week. This is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of his video/karaoke machine and to buy another one.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna. Her previous loan was a big help, in her business of selling vegetables and fruits. She has other businesses, like direct selling, frozen products, and a RTW (ready-to-wear clothing) business. Edna is a widow, and she works hard to provide income to support herself and her children every day.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan, in order to buy more RTW products, like shirts and blouses. She will also use part of the loan in her frozen products and direct selling businesses. Her profits from the businesses will definitely help her to meet her own, and her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Edna hopes to expand her businesses and dreams of having a good life. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her clothing, direct sales, and frozen products businesses, particularly including shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Joana

texts.es:
Joana, de 22 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es soltera pero tiene 2 hermosos hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad respectivamente a quienes quiere mucho y con junto a ellos vive en la casa de su madre a lado de sus hermanos. 
La actividad que realiza Joana es la venta de abarrotes, para eso cuenta con un bodega instalada en su propia casa desde donde atiende a su clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. Se inició hace tan solo 1 año por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico que le permita suplir las necesidades básicas de sus hijos gracias a que pudo tener acceso a un crédito que le ayudó a completar el capital de trabajo que necesitaba para instalar su negocio, con el tiempo ha logrado consolidar su clientela.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en casa y contar con la tranquilidad que necesita para cuidar a sus pequeños hijos, asimismo, puede emplear sus momentos libres en otras actividades  donde perciba algún dinero extra, tiene planes de seguir creciendo y ampliando su bodega ofreciendo a sus clientes mayor variedad de artículos que ellos demandan. Este es el préstamo número 1 con MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para concretar sus planes. Además se siente a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
El monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche y otros al por mayor buscando los precios mas bajos para así obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Joana, age 22, is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead. She is single, but she has 2 beautiful children, aged 7 and 5, respectively, whom she loves very much. Together with them she lives in her mother's house, along with her siblings. 

Joana's work is selling groceries. For this purpose she has a small store set up in her house, where she serves her customers, who are mostly her neighbors. She started only one year ago, due to the need to have an income to allow her to supply the basic necessities to her children. Thankfully she was able to have access to a loan, which helped her to assemble the working capital she needed to set up ber business. With time, she has been able to build up her customer base. 

She likes her business because it allows her to be at home and have the tranquility she needs to take care of her small children. At the same time, she can use her free moments on other activities which bring her some extra money. She has plans to keep growing and expanding her store, offering her customers a greater variety of items that they want. This is her first loan with MFP, and she feels grateful for the financial help they provide to carry out her plans. She also feels happy with her communal bank, since she knows the members and she considers them responsible people with a sense of solidarity. 

The amount she is requesting, 1000 new soles, will be invested in buying rice, sugar, eggs, milk and other products on a wholesale basis, seeking lower prices so that she can obtain greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, eggs, milk and other products on a wholesale basis at lower prices.

loans.name: Suny

texts.es:
Suny, de 21 años, es una mujer amable, buena y muy responsable, convive junto a su pareja con quien tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, vive en su casa propia que construyó junto a su cónyuge como fruto de mucho trabajo. 
Suny tiene como trabajo la venta de combustibles al por mayor y menos. Tiene su negocio instalado en una esquina muy concurrida por vehículos de transporte pesado y vehículos menores como motos y mototaxis. Su trabajo le brinda buenos ingresos y se siente muy tranquila ejerciendo ésta función, lo hace con la ayuda de su pareja desde hace 2 años y gracias a la buena calidad de su combustible y a su agradable atención ha sabido consolidar una buena clientela. 
Le gusta mucho su trabajo, le agrada ver que sus clientes se van muy complacidos y que choferes transitan seguros en sus vehículos. Trabaja por las mañanas mientras que en las tardes regresa a su hogar a cumplir con las funciones de ama de casa mientras su cónyuge continúa brindando el servicio. 
Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que existen personas que le brindan un apoyo financiero que le permitirá estar más tranquila y avanzar con sus planes de su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y sobre todo compenetrarse más con los integrantes de su banco comunal que son muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de combustible para continuar vendiendo.
texts.en:
Suny is 21 years old. She is a friendly, good and very responsible woman. She lives together with her partner, with whom she has a 7-year-old son. She lives in a house of her own, which she built together with her spouse as the result of a lot of work. 

Suny's work is selling fuel, both wholesale and retail. She has set up her business on a corner that has a lot of traffic, both of heavy vehicles and light vehicles such as motorcycles and moto-taxis. Her work provides her with a good income, and she feels great peace of mind doing this work. She has done it for 2 years, with the help of her partner, and thanks to the good quality of her fuel and her agreeable service, she has been able to build up a good customer base. 

She likes her work very much, and she is glad to see that her customers leave very happy and drivers travel safely in their vehicles. She works during the mornings, while in the evenings she returns home to carry out the tasks of a homemaker, while her partner continues providing the service. 
 
This is her loan number 2 with MFP, and she is very happy to know that people exist who provide her financial support, which will permit her to be more tranquil and to advance with her plans for her business. She is also committed to making her payments punctually, and above all to working more closely with the members of her communal bank, who have a strong sense of solidarity. 

With the amount she is requesting, 1000 soles, she will buy a greater quantity of fuel to continue selling it.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of fuel to continue selling it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his devices that customers use to play online and video games.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 29-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be a God-fearing, honest, obedient  woman. 

She operates a quarry business, where she sells building stones to local customers; she has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located at a strategic business area. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business, and especially in the rainy season, it is hard to do the mining. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy building stones.  Her business goal is to increase the size of the mining area by buying mining area land within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy building stones.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a 32-year-old tailor who joined ID last year through a friend who introduced him.

He has been sewing for 9 years now. He started this business in his room, but he gathered enough money to own a kiosk where he has all his goods secured. He is a very hardworking individual who is willing to go the extra mile to satisfy his customers. 

This is his 4th loan, and he is requesting for amount of GHS 600 to buy goods and sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more materials to sell

loans.name: Mankaa

texts.en:
Mankaa is married with four children. They live in a three-room apartment in Ntingkag Mankon, Bamenda, Cameroon.

She had to overcome some challenges in life such as ill health and inadequate business capital, and she was unable to provide the basic needs of her family. These and others encouraged her to join GHAPE in 2010, from which she has taken and successfully repaid loans one time.

She plans to invest her loan in poultry farming. She plans to buy day-old chicks, fowl feed, and feeders. She says she will succeed in this business because she has been doing it for a very long period of time, and thus is now an expert in the field. 

She also says she has customers, that is, she has a ready market for her products. She says this activity will be of great importance to her community, in that they will buy good table birds from her farm, and also they will obtain good manure from her farm.

loans.use: to purchase of day-old chicks, feed and feeders.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is a 56-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 14 years to 32 years. She describes herself as a focused and ambitious woman.
