She operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located within a competitive business environment  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of timber for firewood. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to purchase more firewood to sell. Her business goal is to own a hardware shop within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Robai

texts.en:
Robai is 42 years old. She is a widow and a mother of two children who are 2 and 4 years old respectively.

Robai operates a tailoring shop within the town. She has been doing this business for the last 15 years. Her monthly income is KES. 30,000. 

She is taking her third loan with KADET LTD; she will use the loan to buy more stock. She will use the anticipated profit to employ additional staff.

Robai's dream is to be able to grow and expand her business so that she can comfortably provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy stock for her business.

loans.name: Mwinyi

texts.en: Mwinyi is 40 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their two children, who are in school. He owns a kiosk to earn a living and provide necessities for him family. He sells items that meet major family requirements, including foodstuffs, cereals, greens, and utensils. He has been doing this for some years and so has a lot of experience and some regular customers who come to him every day. He has a strategic location for the business, and it is also worth mentioning that there is not much competition. His dream is for his children to have a better life than he has had. Every day he wakes up early to earn the necessary money to bring fresh greens from the nearby market, and he wants to keep his business going for a long time, as it is his principal source of income. So, to do this, he decided to apply for a loan of KES 25,000, so he can expand his stall and restock necessary supplies, such as flour, sugar, milk, margarine, greens and cereals. He believes that, only by doing this, will he manage to realize his dream of giving his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her food stall.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 20 years to 35 years. She describes herself to be an honest woman.

She operates a retail store where she sells clothes such as skirts and shirts, and bed covers, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located at a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of clothes.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to buy bales of clothes and resell within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi, who is 35, lives with her husband and two children - both of whom are in school. She has a business selling clothing for women and children, and has gained a lot of sales experience which has helped her increase her earnings. She trades from her home and door-to-door in her neighborhood. Her customers like her products due to the high quality, good prices, and above all, the excellent service.

She is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and eager to succeed. She is always on the look-out for new opportunities to enable her to be one step closer to success, and she will never give up. 

She has experienced increased demand and she wants to invest in her business in order to take advantage of this. In order to expand her business she  has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Yehu to purchase wholesale clothing. Mwanarusi has good repayment references and a strong moral character. She ensures that she will repay the debt and this will enable her to give her family a full support.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 52-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be an honest woman. She operates a retail shop  where she sells farm and animal feed products. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located at a local residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm and agricultural products. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler  within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She also runs a grocery store which increases her business income.

loans.use: to buy farm and animal feed products

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Adama.  She is married and has children aged 21 and 19 years. In 2005, Adama established her  cement business. She began her business because she needed to assist her husband in bringing up their children in terms of providng livelihood and paying for their education. Her husband gave her an amount of money to establish her own business.  

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,000,000. Adama has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more bags of cement for her business. In the future, Adama plans to complete building her store and help in paying for her children’s education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement for her business

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is married and has four children. She is 48 years old and lives in Mailen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Karen owns and operates a transportation business to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and earns 10,000 PHP each month. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP, to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

Karen joined Kiva's partner, GDMPC, in 2012. She hopes to have an increase in income and to have a better life, in the future.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the transportation business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy ingredients used in making macapuno (a type of coconut dessert). Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. She is also selling frozen products for additional income. She is continuously working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy ingredients used in making macapuno. She will also use the loan for buying frozen goods like hot dogs, ham, stuffed pork and other items. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Evelyn hopes that she will have a good life and dreams to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients used in making macapuno (coconut dessert).

loans.name: Lebert

texts.en:
Lebert, 22 years old, is a single entrepreneur from Bayabas, Aurora. He is earning from his transport service business. It started almost two years ago, and he earns 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. 

To improve business, he is borrowing the amount of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC Microcredit, which he just joined in 2012, to obtain accessories and tires. Before too long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paint and to waterproof the roof of her house

loans.name: Sindiya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sindiya, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 29 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillements et d’articles divers de boutique.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Sindiya sont à leur deuxième prêt. 
La cliente NAYINI, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter 10 complets de brodé avec les grossistes de Burkina  pour ensuite revendre sur place à la maison en ambulante et au marché de Fana.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce d’habits.
texts.en:
The women of the group Sindiya, which is composed exclusively of married women, average 29 years of age and two children each, all living in traditional extended families in Fana City, in Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in clothing and general shop goods. 

The women of the group Sindiya are on their second loan.

This client, Nayini, the second person from the left in the photo, intends to purchase 10 embroidered outfits from Burkina wholesalers and then sell them locally at the house, by going door to door, and at the Fana market.  

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs. Part of the profits will be reinvested in the clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 37 years old. She is married with six children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest is 4. Her husband sells alcohol. She has been in business for four years. She wants a loan to buy more food goods such as peas, beans and bananas. Wih the profit she will pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more beans, bananas and peas for sale.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou  est un maçon qui a une expérience de plus de 20 ans. Il est marié et père de famille. Il vient pour la première fois sollicité un crédit de 400000F CFA pour acheter  du bois de coffrage et renforcer son stock, ce qui lui évitera de louer à chaque fois qu’il aura un chantier à exécuter. Mamadou prend en charge les dépenses journalières de sa famille. Il pourra mettre en place une épargne régulière grâce au crédit. Mais aussi améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille. Il souhaite agrandir son équipement en planche.
texts.en:
Mamadou is a mason who has more than 20 years of experience in his field.  He is married and has a family.  He is requesting a loan of 400,000 CFA francs in order to purchase some wooden framework and increase his stock (of wood boards), which will prevent him from renting each time he is working on a construction site.  This is his first loan.

Mamadou takes care of his family's day-to-day expenses.  Thanks to this loan, he will be able to regularly put some money into saving and to improve his family's diet.  He would like to expand his stock of wood boards.

loans.use: to buy wooden framework (wood boards)

loans.name: Sari Maju Group

texts.en:
Although some members of the group suffered a loss in their business, the Sari Maju group continues borrowing. With another loan, they want to continue the business of pig farming. (One group member quit and is continuing her efforts in other businesses.)

Ni Komang will use her share of the loan to buy three piglets and feed for them. The plan is, she will keep fattening the pigs. She hopes that the results of this effort will be profits that she will use to repair her family's home, which leaks when there is rain.

loans.use: To buy three piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 43 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school; she works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 45 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Grace has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Grace would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married and has three children. She is 47 years old and lives in Balili, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. 

Teresita owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting corn to sell to earn a living. She has been in this business for six years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of business. Teresita requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

In 2010, Teresita joined GDMPC. She hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy items like detergent, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari (general) store.

Lolita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to provide financial stability to her family.

loans.use: to buy items like detergent, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari (general) store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a movable food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy transistors, diodes, and coils in order to continue fixing electronic equipment.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
This is Lucila. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for a new 20,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lucila dreams to have more businesses in the future and hopes to have good health for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Filipino.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of the jeepney.

loans.name: Yulisa Liseth

texts.es:
En el municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón un pequeño pueblo, donde existen diversas actividades comerciales, es aquí donde habita la señora Yuliza de 27 años de edad.

Yulisa es casada, su esposo no posee ingresos, por lo que se encuentra desempleado y sus principales  funciones el brindar sus servició en uno de los centro de salud de su municipio, con lo poco que ella gana a duras peña sostiene el sustento de su hogar. 

Solo cuenta con su buena salud, su capacidad de trabajo, su honradez que es lo que la ha mantenido bien, hoy en día solicita un crédito con ceprodel donde lo estará invirtiendo en la compra de: Zin y Madera para poder mejorar el techo de su vivienda, ya que los fenómenos naturales le han afectado mucho.
texts.en:
In the small town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, there are many diverse commercial activities.  It is here that Yuliza lives.  She is twenty-seven years old.

Yulisa is married.  Her husband does not possess an income; he is unemployed.   Her principal function is to offer her services in one of the health centers in her town.  With the little amount she receives, she is able to sustain the livelihood of her home.

She only has her good health, her ability to work, and her honesty that she has maintained well.  Today she is requesting a loan with Ceprodel.  She will invest in the purchase of corrugated metal roofing and wood in order to be able to improve the roof of her home, since natural disasters have affected her a lot.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal roofing and wood.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
El señor Jorge es propietario de una tienda de ropa, donde tiene una variedad de productos como camisetas, trajes infantiles, pantalones, ropa interior.

Su demanda ha crecido y sus clientes le preguntan por zapatos de cuero de Masaya, un producto elaborado en Masaya, una ciudad comercial importante en Nicaragua.

El necesita un financiamiento para comprar un pedido de camisas, camisetas, ropa de ninos, y zapatos con los que se proyecta satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Estableció su negocio con el apoyo económico de su madre, quien también es comerciante de ropa nueva, después que termino su secundaria.


Su estado civil es soltero y con un alto potencial de desarrollo como microempresario de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
Jorge is the proprietor of a clothing store where he has a variety of products such as t-shirts, children's outfits, pants, and underwear.  His demand has grown and his customers ask him for leather shoes made in Masaya, an important commercial city in Nicaragua.

He needs a loan to buy an order of blouses, shirts, children's outfits, and shoes with which he projects he'll satisfy the needs of his customers.

After he finished secondary school, he set up his business with economic support from his mother, who also is a merchant of new clothing.

He's single and has a high potential for developing as a micro-entrepreneur of new clothing.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, children's outfits, and shoes

loans.name: Luisa Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Luisa es una mujer luchadora, de profesión licenciada en ingles, actualmente se desempeña como maestra de educación secundaria de un colegio del departamento de león, es Madre soltera con una hija la que goza de todo el apoyo para su superación académica, 

Una de las necesidades que la señora luisa atraviesa hoy en día, es de mejorar sus condiciones tanto laborales como académica de su hija, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de una Computadora la que le brindara las facilidades laborales y para el uso de  su hija para mejorar el nivel tecnológico, por medio de esta adquisición  brindara mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Luisa is a hardworking woman.  She has a Bachelor’s degree in English and currently works as a secondary school teacher in a school in León Department.  She’s a single mother of a daughter whose academic improvement she totally supports.

One of Luisa’s needs currently is to improve both her working conditions and her daughter’s schooling which is why she’s decided to approach Ceprodel to request a loan to buy a computer that will help her both at work and that her daughter can use to improve her technological skills.  This purchase will provide them with better conditions.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es:
Sadith, de 30 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Wilfredo de 34 años y sus 4 queridos hijos de 13, 12, 7 y 5 años de edad respectivamente, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Sadith consiste en la venta de diversos productos, ya sean productos de limpieza, productos lácteos, artículos de hogar, entre otros. Dependiendo de la temporada se abastece de cualquiera de estos productos y los ofrece de manera ambulatoria entre sus amigos, familiares y clientes ocasionales. La calidad de todo lo que ofrece se plasma en las marcas reconocidas que son de la preferencia de sus clientes. Sus ventas son generalmente a créditos y solo en algunas ocasiones vende al contado. Empezó vendiendo poco y solo a algunos clientes pero con el tiempo fue ampliando su cartera de clientes que ahora le compran en grandes cantidades. Cumple esta labor desde hace 2 años.

Le gusta su actividad ya que siente que su trabajo esta dando los frutos que esperaba, considera que le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene buenas ventas, genera buenos ingresos económicos y además progresa cada día mas, con el paso del tiempo espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos sin tener que salir a las calles.
Con en monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará más productos detergentes, jabones y lejías para vender en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Sadith, 30, is a very humble and hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband Wilfredo, 34, and her four beloved children, ages 13, 12, 7, and 5, whom she wants to give a better quality of life.

Sadith's job is selling a variety of products, whether cleaning products, dairy products, or household products, among others.  She stocks up on these products depending on the season and sells them on foot to her friends, relatives, and occasional customers.  The quality of everything she sells is evident in the well-known brands that her customers prefer.

Her sales are generally on credit; she sells in cash only occasionally.  She began selling a little and only to some customers, but in time she began expanding her list of customers, who now buy from her in large quantities.  She has done this work for two years.

She likes her job because she feels her work is giving the results she wanted.  She thinks it's going very well for her because she has good sales, she generates good income, and she also progresses more every day.  She hopes in time to have a store where she can sell her products without having to go out to sell in the streets.

With the requested amount of 1000 soles [PEN], she'll buy more detergent, soap, and bleach to sell this season.

loans.use: to buy detergent, soap, and bleach

loans.name: Mareche

texts.en: Mareche is from Tagulalo, Aurora. She is 28 years old, married and has two children. To make a living, Mareche owns and operates a rope manufacturing business. Mareche has been engaged in her business for two years and earns 4,000 a month from the business. In 2012, Mareche joined GDMPC. Mareche is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture new rope products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture new rope products

loans.name: Argie

texts.en: Argie is a 26-year old resident of Mahayahay, Aurora. Argie helps contribute to the needs of his family from the little amount of 6,000 he earns monthly from his own piggery business. He has had the business for 2 years. However, this year he became a member of GDMPC and has applied for a 10,000 PHP loan at GDMPC micro finance to buy feeding supplies. Argie wishes to expand his business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 59 years old and married with five children. She lives in Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She's been engaged in a charcoal sales business as a way of gaining an income for 30 years, and she earns 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. She has been a member of GDPMC since 2001. 

She is now requesting a loan of 22,000 PHP to pay for the labor costs of charcoal making. She hopes to be able to buy an additional hectare of land for her coconut production.

loans.use: to pay for the labor costs of charcoal making.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.en:
This is Pastor. He previously accessed a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that he utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in his ornamental plant business. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household and business expenditures. His business is continuously growing as he works hard to provide income for everyday needs.

He would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed in his business. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Pastor hopes that his business will grow bigger and dreams to have a better life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for pots, wire, fertilizers and other things needed in his business.

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en:
The group received the amount of 15.5M IDR (Indonesian rupiah), and each will receive different loan sizes depending on their needs.

Ni Luh will use the loan to purchase two superior piglets and feed. Each of the superior piglets now is 475.000 IDR. She will maintain them for six months for fattening. She hopes the business will keep running well, and she can earn enough profit at the end.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Medina is borrowing 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Medina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Mariza

texts.en: This time Ma. Mariza is requesting a loan of Php 20,000 to buy more fish to sell to her customers. Her agricultural business that she previously funded through NWTF, a Kiva field partner, continues to provide for Ma. Mariza and her family. That loan has increased her income and improved her familly's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nena requested a 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like snack foods, sardines and other miscellaneous items.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Nena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like snack foods, sardines and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Sumbersari Permai Group

texts.en:
To increase their business, the Sumbersari Permai group continues to borrow their loans from MUK. They feel comfortable to have the loan, because they also have been trained by the MUK staff. Ni Kadek, the head of the group, has two children. Her oldest daughter, 7, is in her first years in elementary school and her second child is still a toddler. Her husband works as a farmer on his own land. 

After succeeding with the last loan, Ni Kadek continues to borrow money to purchase two superior piglets to sell as fattening pig. Now the price for one superior piglet is Rp.475.000.

All the profit from this business is used to support her children's education. She hopes the business will grow and that she becomes a successful pig breeder.

loans.use: to buy two superior quality piglets

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Rosa successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fish-vending business by buying more fish.

NWTF is presenting Rosa's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Made

texts.en: After success with her last loan, Made used her new loan to purchase feeds for her 25 piglets. The cage was already renovated by her last loan, and now all the piglets stay in a healthy and comfortable cage. She has a plan to sell all the piglets after five months, and she hopes she can sell them all. All the profit from this business will be saved for the preparation of her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase feeds.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 57 years old, a widow and has two children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a transportation services business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motorcycle-transport services. Gloria been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gloria joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair the existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair the existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is from Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Lorna is married and has two children. To make a living, Lorna operates a family member's business providing motor transport services. Lorna has been engaged in this business for six years and earns 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Lorna joined GDMPC. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Divine Grace

texts.en:
Divine Grace is from Centro Napo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children. Divine Grace provides a motorcycle transport service. Divine Grace has been engaged in this business for five years and earns 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month from it. 

In 2010, Divine Grace joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is from Tinaclaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 62 years old. Florencio is married and has three children. To make a living, he owns and operates a tricycle transport service. He has been in his business for 30 years and earns 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month from these activities. 

In 2010, Florencio joined GDMPC. Florencio is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo for a dairy and livestock business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Edith is from Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is 49 years old. Edith is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Edith makes & sells candles to locals. Edith has been engaged in her business for 20 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Edith joined GDMPC. Edith is requesting a loan of 20,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed in making candles for sale. She plans to save her returns to pay for the tuition of her children.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in making candles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a hog raising business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from abaca weaving. Nenita is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a variety store in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like detergent, sugar, canned goods and other groceries.

Evelyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

NWTF is relisting Evelyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like detergent, sugar, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 52-year-old lady from Majengo in Kakamega County. She is married to Aladin and they have three children whose ages are 12, 17 and 26 years old respectively.

Alice operates a green grocery which she has been doing for the last three years.  She makes a monthly income of KES. 40,000. She is applying for her third loan with KADET LTD which she will use to buy more stock, and she will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

She has a hope of becoming a successful and large green grocery owner to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock for the business.

loans.name: Kazungu

texts.en:
Kazungu is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He has a transport business and owns motocycles, a business he has run for two years. Besides this, Kazungu also owns rental houses. He is married and has two school aged children.
Kazungu was introduced to Milango by his friends and he is applying for a loan of 73,050 Kenya shillings to purchase a motorcycle.
He desires to own a three wheeled vehicle in future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Aciro Okello

texts.en:
Aciro is a 32-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has 4 children between the ages of 2 and 10. Three of them go to school.

Aciro runs a general store, and has been in business for 5 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 1500ssp to purchase flour, oil, and many other items for her store.  The general store is her only source of income.
In 5 years Aciro would like to expand her business.

Her major challenges include high prices at the market.
Aciro says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like maize flour, cassava flour, oil etc.

loans.name: Urtnasan

texts.en: Mrs. Urtnasan, 45 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on plot of land. She and her husband have been running an auto service business since 2000 and have accumulated a vast amount of experience in this type of business. First she purchases old automobiles and spare parts from outdoor markets at low prices and then her husband repairs the old automobiles with spare parts and sells them to customers when they are finished. In the beginning of the business, they were using their yard as a repair site and later built a garage which is specifically built for auto service. In order to expand her business, she is requesting a loan of 4000000 MNT to purchase old damaged automobiles and spare parts. As a result, they can generate more income for their children’s education. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who doesn’t use alcohol or tobacco at all. She and her husband are strict about time and money.

loans.use: to purchase old/damaged automobiles and spare parts.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 44 years old. She lives in the Kutaisi District of Georgia with her husband, their 2 children and her mother. Her mother is provided with a retirement pension. Tamar requested loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of income for the family is Tamar’s salary working as a sales lady at a local grocery store. She only makes 300 Laris per month. It is hardly enough to supply food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Tamar requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With this loan Tamar will purchase clothing for resell. She plans to go to Turkey and buy clothing to resale in her village at a higher price. This will increase the income of her family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw material such as mirror, paint for her decoration making business.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
This is Bella. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used buy more fruits and vegetables. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household and business expenses. This has been her business for five years, and it is continuously growing.
She would like to apply for another loan, of 17,000 PHP, to buy more fruits and vegetables needed in her business. The profits from her business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial growth with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Bella hopes to expand her business and gain more customers. She dreams of having her own house and having it renovated. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for various fruits and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Davaa-Erdene

texts.en: Mr. Davaa-Erdene, 29 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in his house on a plot of land. He operates an internet café, provides origination service, sells CDs, and takes photographs. His wife also helps his business by working as a cashier at his internet café. In this business field, he has accumulated vast amount of experience and attracted quite a number of permanent customers. He is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase an electric car, which will be beneficial to the cause of environmental protection. Electric cars contribute to cleaner air in cities because they produce no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from an onboard power source, such as particulates, volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. The family plans to use their automobile as a means of transporting computers and other materials used in their business.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik is involved in agriculture. She keeps 4 cows, 3 sheep and owns agricultural land where nut, apple and pear trees are grown.
Together with agriculture, Astghik also works at a local school as a teacher. She gets a monthly income, but it is enough only to cover her basic needs. Agriculture helps her to have stable income and sustain her family. Despite her young age, Astghik is a very hardworking lady and is the only breadwinner of the family. So, in order to expand her agricultural business she has applied for this loan. With the help of the loan she will purchase a cows and forage for feeding the livestock. This will enable her to increase sales of milk products and get a higher income.
Astghik lives with her mother, sister and brother in the town of Jermuk.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Mary Wani

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 2 and 6. One of them goes to school.
Mary has a fish selling business, and has been running it for 3 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 1500ssp to purchase fish and okra.  This is her only source of income.  In 5 years Mary would like to expand her business.
Her major challenges include high prices in the market.
Mary says she is happy for the loans given by finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more fish and okra.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence has been doing well. She has opened up a second business, of selling wraps and other African attire. She is now applying for her third loan, after repaying the second one successfully, to purchase more wraps and African-designed materials for her boutique.

loans.use: to purchase wraps and African-designed materials for her boutique.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en: Zaza is 48 years old and from the small village of Telavi district, Kakheti Region, East Georgia. Zaza lives with his parents, 2 children and a daughter-in-law. His parents are provided with a retirement pension. Zaza owns a car and serves local people as a taxi driver.  For this he receives a monthly income. The family is also involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production, and 2 pigs. They have a hectare agricultural land, where maize is grown. They sell cheese and maize locally at a good price. Zaza is very hard working man and has much experience in his business. Zaza requested a loan for purchasing calves. After purchasing calves he will raise them and thus expand his herd. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Zaza awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal, and fresh fruits for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Telma

texts.en:
This is Telma. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy a larger stock of tanks of LPG. Her earnings have been a big help in the education of her children and with their personal, household and business expenses. She has been  in this business only one year, but it is growing and she has established good relationships with her customers.
She would like to apply for another loan, of 17,000 PHP, to buy more tanks of LPG and expand her product inventory. The profits from her business will definitely help her to meet the family’s daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial growth with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.
Telma hopes that her children will finish their studies, and she dreams of experiencing a prosperous life. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more tanks of LPG to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Mungun-Ochir

texts.en: Mr. Mungun-Ochir, 30 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. His wife works as a washerwoman at a private business entity. He himself provides taxi service to local people, and his main route for taxi service is between the post office and the train station. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some interior repair. Also, he needs an automobile garage. He is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy construction materials, such as wood, concrete, gypsum and bricks. At this time, the price of construction materials is at its lowest, and he can save a considerable amount of money. The renovated house can provide a comfortable and warm place for the family, which will burn less coal in winter time. The garage that he will build can shelter his car from external hazards, such as storm, frost and excess heat. A well-protected automobile emits less smoke, due to efficiency in consuming its fuel, and thus contributes greatly to the efforts to limit air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to repair his house and build a garage for his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and rent a shopping stall/venue.

loans.name: Armik

texts.en:
Armik is 60 years old. She lives with her husband and has been involved in agriculture for more than 10 years. Armik keeps three cows and gets milk, which she uses in cheese production. Her husband Razmik helps her to sell that milk in local markets. Their monthly income comes from agriculture, so Armik would like to expand it. She has applied for this loan to purchase two cows. This will enable her to get more milk and will significantly increase the family's income.
The loan is very important for this family to increase their income and make their living conditions better.

loans.use: to pay for two cows.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
This is Annalyn, she previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. Over the years, she was able to add other inventory such as electronic loads, mineral water and processed food.  Her businesses are continuously growing as she and her husband work hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result of a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Annalyn hopes that her variety store will become a grocery store. She dreams that her children will finish their studies and will receive more blessings this year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and a piece of land to construct a shopping stall/venue.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
This is Sabina, she previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy raw materials for her bamboo furniture business. Her earnings were a big help with the education expenses of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She has been in this business for 5 years now and it is continually growing. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy raw materials like bamboo, burnish and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sabina hopes that her business will expand and get bigger. She dreams to give her children a good and quality education and be able to have a vacation. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.



* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials like bamboo, burnish and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Maricel works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells recycled materials in the Philippines. Maricel is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of recycled materials to sell for her business.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities with her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. Wilma is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Wilma has requested a loan of 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials such as fishing nets and paint for her fishing business.

Wilma has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy material for her fishing business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Rosita works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Rosita is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can educate of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is 20 years old. He lives in the small village of Khoni District with his grandmother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Levan requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for his family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow and a calf, whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides this, Levan owns half a hectare of land, where maize is grown. They sell cheese and maize locally at a good price. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Levan requested a loan from Credo for a family business start-up. His loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Levan will build a shed for hens. After the shed is built he will be able expand his livestock. This will increase his family's income. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to build a hen-shed.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George lives in the town of Rustavi. He is 40 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children, who are 8 and 12 years old. The children go to the local school. George works as the driver of a government-owned mini-bus and earns a monthly income. He decided to start his own business as his existing income isn’t enough for the four-member family. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restartup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, George will purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Along with the above mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, if needed.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Marta works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marta is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

Marta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to exapnd her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
This is Madelyn. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy different ingredients for making rice cake. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for their personal, household, and business expenses. In her four years in the business, she was able to establish a good relationship with customers who became loyal to her. She and her husband are working hard to continually provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy various ingredients for making rice cake, such as sugar, coconut, glutinous rice and others. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Madelyn hopes to have her own stall and dreams to give her children a good and beautiful future. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making rice cake, such as sugar, coconut, and glutinous rice

loans.name: Rda

texts.en:
Rda is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married, and has two children. Both Rda and his children provide the family income. Rda owns a small shop and specializes in water purification. He established his business in 2008, and now he has an employee. He has good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area by his excellent reputation.

Rda is requesting a sum of 1,500 USD to buy two new water filters and to install a new ceiling for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy two new water filters and to install a new ceiling for his shop

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is married with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Annabelle is 37 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Annabelle has a business of buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a loan of 25,000 PHP amount through NWTF to buy more stock of vegetables to sell.

Annabelle has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Annabelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en:
Mousa is from Iraq. He is 61 years old, married and is the father of five children. Mousa is the only provider of the family.

Mousa owns a small shop and specializes in repairing heaters and motor generators. He established his business in 2009 and now he has an employee. He built good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Mousa is requesting a loan of $2,000 to pay the yearly rent of his shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent of his shop and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Rufina requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing materials for her business. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rufina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Elsa requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her business.  She has been in this business for 9 years now.

In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
This is Maura. Her previous loan was a big help in her food stall business. She has been in this business for four years now and it is continuously growing. She also has a variety store that she is now focusing more on. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan for her to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Maura hopes to expand her store and simply dreams to have a good life with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Thinh

texts.en: Thinh is requesting a new loan to buy glasses and a sugarcane juice making machine. Thinh's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy glasses and a sugarcane juice making machine

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Bendiya  qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 3 enfants, vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Sido,  préfecture de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur quatorzième prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales, condiments  et des articles divers. 
Diakassan, qui est la seule assise devant fait de la vente de céréales.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, 9 sacs de riz de production locale auprès des paysans producteurs de Sido et environs. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 55.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités, pour les frais de santé  et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The members of the Bendiya group have an average age of 37 years and an average of three children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Sido, in the prefecture of Bougouni.

These women met one another through neighborly, friendly, and business relationships. In order to strengthen their financial capacity so that they can better conduct their business, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their fourth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. This group of women buys and sells grains, condiments, and other various items.

Diakassan, who is the woman seated at the very front in the photo, sells grains.

She plans to use her loan to buy 9 bags of locally produced rice from smallholder producers in Sido and the surrounding areas. She sells her goods at the market and from home, on a small scale, for cash or for credit, to a clientele made up of both men and women.

She plans to earn an average monthly profit of 55,000 FCFA, which she will use to invest in her business, cover her medical expenses, and pay back her loan.

loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Lasha

texts.en: Lasha is 36 years old. He lives with his wife in a small village of Akhmeta district, East Georgia. Lasha works as an artisan and earns a monthly income. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milk cows whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese locally in an open market at a good price. Lasha is a very hardworking young man and has rich experience in his business. He requested a loan to purchase calves. After purchasing the calves, Lasha will expand the livestock and thus increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es casado y vive con su familia en un pequeño cuarto en la zona de Sopocachi. Trabaja como vendedor de llantas y aros de autos junto a su esposa con lo que tratan de mantener a su familia día a día. El crédito que solicitó es para poder construir un cuarto donde pueda usarlo como depósito de su mercadería y así poder vivir un poco más cómodos. 

El sueño de Mario es poder ahorrar lo suficiente para abrir una tienda y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

Es la segunda vez que trabaja con Kiva.
texts.en:
Mario is married, and he lives with his family in a small room in the Sopocachi area.  He works with his wife selling auto tires and rims.  Through their sales they try to support their family day to day.

The loan he requested is to be able to build a room that he can use to store his merchandise.  This way they will be able to live a little more comfortably.

Mario’s dream is to be able to save enough to open a store in order to improve his quality of life.

This is the second time that he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to build a room to store his merchandise comprised of tires and rims.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga comes from the village of Kistauri in the Kakheti region. She is 35 years old and lives with her husband, parents-in-law and children. All the family members are involved in agricultural activities. They have agricultural land and sow different kinds of vegetables. Also, her husband works at the wine factory. 

Her father-in-law is provided with a retirement pension and her mother-in-law trades clothing in their village and nearby villages. All the family members work hard to make some savings and improve their living conditions. With the requested credit, Inga plans to build a bath house for the family, as they don’t have one now. It will significantly improve the quality of life for the family.

loans.use: to build a bath house for the family.

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
Carla es madre soltera y vive con sus padres en la zona de San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja como auxiliar de aula de nivel primaria en un colegio pequeño donde sus ingresos son insuficientes para poder pagar sus estudios. Es por eso que requiere el crédito, para pagar las pensiones y poder continuar con su carrera de pedagogía.

El sueño de Carla es  salir profesional y poder acceder a un mejor empleo con mejor renumeración para poder independizarse.

Es la primera vez que trabaja con Kiva.
texts.en:
Carla is a single mother, and she lives with her parents in the San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.  She works as a classroom helper at a small elementary school.  She does not get enough income to pay for her education.  That is why she needs a loan to pay her school fees and to be able to continue her education program.

Carla’s dream is to become a professional and to be able to get a better job with better pay.  She wants to do this in order to be able to become independent.

This is her first time working with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the University fees where she is studying education.

loans.name: Bercy

texts.en:
This is Bercy. She previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. She also sells dried fish and ready-to-wear products.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. She will also use the loan to buy dried fish and RTW products like shirts and blouses. The profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Bercy hopes to have more customers that will patronize her businesses and dreams to give a good future to her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa es casada y vive en la zona de Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, su hogar necesita muchas refacciones que no puede pagar por lo que sus condiciones de vida son bastante malas. Trabaja como comerciante de ropa y su esposo trabaja en otro departamento de Bolivia mandando una cantidad de dinero limitada al mes para su familia. Requiere el crédito para la compra de mercadería (ropa de hombre y mujer) que le servirá para ampliar su negocio.

El sueño de Nicolasa es poder ahorrar lo suficiente y hacer las refacciones de su casa para mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.

Es la primera vez que trabaja con Kiva.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is married, and she lives in the Nuevo Potosí area of the city of La Paz.  Her home needs a lot of repairs, which she is not able to pay for.  Her living conditions are quite bad.

She works selling clothes.  Her husband works in another department in Bolivia, and he sends a limited amount of money monthly for the family.

She needs the loan to buy merchandise (clothing for men and women), which will serve to expand her business.

Nicolosa’s dream is to be able to save enough and to make the repairs to her house.  She wants to do this in order to improve her family’s living conditions.

This is the first time she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing for her business.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh is requesting a new loan to purchase furniture for her food stall and to buy ingredients to make fish balls to serve to her customers. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, which would help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Vicky Edward

texts.en:
Vicky is a 30-yr-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 3 and 9. All of them go to school. Vicky runs a clothes selling business, and has been in business for 7 years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. 

She is taking a loan of 2,000 SSP to purchase clothes and many other items to sell.  She has no other source of income in addition to this business. In 5 years Vicky would like to expand her business and open a boutique. Her major challenges include the high prices in the market.

She says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and other items to sell.

loans.name: Voileta

texts.en:
Voileta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. She earns more income from a boarding house. 

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. Voileta dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Valiko

texts.en:
Valiko is from the village of Matani, East Georgia. He is 49 years old. Valiko lives with his wife, who is a housewife, and a son. 

Valiko serves local farmers with his own tractor during tilling and mowing season and gets a service fee. He works hard but the income is enough only to cover the family's daily essential expenses. 

Valiko requested a loan for renovation of the kitchen, as it is in bad condition. After he pays back this loan, he plans to start renovation of other parts of the house in order to improve the living conditions for his big family.

loans.use: to renovate the kitchen.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 35-year-old lady from Kakamega County. She is married to Francis and they have two children who are 7 and 10 years old.

Violet operates Aggro-Vet and a retail shop within the region. For the last 13 years, she has been helping many community members whose living standard is very low by offering them affordable commodities. She makes an income of KES 80,000 per month. 

She is taking her third loan with KADET Ltd., which she will use to purchase more medicines and agricultural supplies to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to open another Aggro-Vet in the nearby village.

She has a dream of expanding her business to help her generate enough income for her family so that she may educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines and agricultural supplies to sell.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es comerciante de libros y además trabaja como impulsadora de supermercados. Su esposo se dedica al mantenimiento de computadoras y aparatos electrónicos. Vive en alquiler en la zona de Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz donde su calidad de vida no es la mejor para su familia.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar más libros y poder ofrecer mayor variedad a su clientela.

El sueño de Natalia es hacer crecer su negocio de venta de libros y así poder mudar a su familia a un mejor hogar.

Es la primera vez que trabaja con Kiva.
texts.en:
Natalia sells books, and she also works as a product promoter in supermarkets.  Her husband performs maintenance on computers and electronic devices.  She rents where she lives in the Pampahasi area of the City of La Paz.  Their quality of life there is not the best for her family.

She needs the loan to buy more books and to be able to offer her customers greater variety.

Natalia’s dream is to make her book selling business grow.  That way her family will be able to move to a better home.

This is the first time she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more books in order to be able to offer her customers greater variety.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 40 years old and married with 3 children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 9 years.

She requested an 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like fishing nets, wood and paints for the repair of her fishing boat.  In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she could finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials like fishing nets, wood and paints for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 45 years old, married, and supports a family of five. He has been operating a general store for the last 10 years, making a monthly income of about KES 45,000. 

He has applied for his second loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, with which he plans to restock his shop with tea leaves, cooking fat and crates of milk to sell. The anticipated profits will help pay school fees. His future plans are to expand his business and improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to restock his shop with tea leaves, cooking fat and crates of milk to sell.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza lives in the Telavi district of East Georgia. She is 24 years old and lives with her husband and two children. She runs an agricultural business. In particular, she has a vineyard and a plot of land where different kinds of vegetables are grown. Eliza’s husband takes wood from the forest and sells it in the village. The couple works hard to make some savings and improve their living conditions for their children. 

With the requested loan Eliza will purchase a car, and her husband will use it to take more wood from the forest and sell it in their local village, as well as in nearby villages. This will increase the family income during the winter season. The increased profit will be reinvested in the family's agricultural activities, and all members of the family will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a car to take the wood from the forest

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 22-year-old single woman from Cortes, Bohol, Philippines. 

She has been engaged in a food vending business for sometime now. She sells home-cooked snack foods to the people in her place. 

Juliet wants to expand her business but lacks the resources to do so. She would like to take a loan from CEVI to buy additional ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar, margarine, cooking oil and others. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more snack food to the people in her place, thus augmenting her sales and income.

In the future, Juliet hopes to make her business a success so that she will be able to earn more and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar, margarine, cooking oil and others.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
