Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, está muy agradecida al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, además está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500), comprará mayor cantidad de productos con los que implementará su tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, huevos, fideos, verduras, frutas y otros artículos.
texts.en:
Zulita, 40, is an enterprising, work loving woman. She has three children, aged 19, 16 and 8 months, and lives together with her partner. They live together in their own home, which they built as a result of years of hard work, effort and saving. They love each other and she works hard to ensure that they succeed.

Zulita's business sells groceries and basic necessities. She opens her shop very early every day to serve the customers who come to her shop in search of products. Her store is the best stocked in her neighbourhood and her customers do not hesitate to shop there, not only because of this, also because of the quality brands hat she offers and the warm and friendly service that she provides with every word so that her customers always feel welcome.

She remembers that, when she started her business, she did not have many products and she could not get good sales during the day. However she looked for a solution, raised a small amount of capital and in small stages she went about setting up her little shop and now her sales are going well. She has now been running her business for 3 years and always receives help from her partner.

Her favourite thing about work is talking to her customers and seeing them starts her day with a smile. She thinks the hardest thing is getting up early to work in the shop and raising her baby when she is so tired. She knows that it is her job and needs to be done however, and she hopes that in the future her business will grow and will provide better economic rewards.

This is her second loan with MFP, she is grateful for the knowledge that she has financial support as it helps her to feel more secure when advancing with her business, she also commits to making her payments according to the schedule. She is happy to belong to her communal bank as all of the members are responsible and caring.

With the requested money (1500 PEN) she will buy wholesale products to stock her grocery store with items like rice, sugar, eggs, beans, greens and fruits, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, eggs, beans, vegetables, fruits and other items.

loans.name: Fauzia

texts.en:
Fauzia lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has eight children, the youngest two of whom are in school. She owns a food cafe, a business she has been operating for five years. Apart from this, she earns an income from a farming business. She also sells clothes.

She learned about Milango through one of its employees, who invited her to a group. She joined Milango with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenges she is facing include price fluctuations and bad debts.

Fauzia is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy food ingredients, like flour, cereals and cooking fat. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings, and used to improve the living standard of her family and to pay her children’s school fees. Her plan for the future is to expand through opening another food cafe.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients, like flour, cereals and cooking fat.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en: Riziki  is a 29-year-old married woman who has five children. She owns a rental house where she provides housing accommodations. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high land rent. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to pay for the renovation of the rental house. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the rental house.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 47-year-old married man who has four children. He describes himself to be loving and determined. He operates a butcher shop and grocery store  where he sells meat and fruits. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in an agricultural business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate meat for selling. He will use the KES 15000 loan to buy meat to sell. His business goal is to be a supplier of meat and fruits within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 33-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself as a focused and determined man. He operates a farm stand where he sells maize and beans. His business is located on agricultural land and his primary customers are local residents and schools. He describes his biggest business challenge to be occasional weather changes which lead to crops drying up and greatly affecting his business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy maize and bean seedlings. His business goal is to be a supplier of cereals within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy maize and bean seedlings

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She has two children, ages 24 years and 28 years. She describes herself to be a humble woman. She operates a retail store where she sells household items. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Florence will use the KES 15,600 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her four family members. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. This is Florence's first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Ylli

texts.en:
Ylli is a 30-year-old single man who lives with his father in a town in southeastern Albania; his mother passed away long ago, leaving him at a very young age. He has got plans; he wants to get married soon. But before that, he needs some money to stock up on inventory items for his little bar-caffe restaurant that he has been operating for almost a year now. 

Ylli has been experiencing good profitability from his business and wants to expand his services by offering more items on the menu. In order to achieve this, he requests a loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek. He is hoping that lenders will show some understanding in this matter and assist him financially.

loans.use: To stock up on inventory items for his little bar-caffe restaurant

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 49 years old, and lives in the Airport surroundings. She was too unfortunate to attend school, and she is married and has six children between 12 to 30 years old. Only two are living with her and going to school. For the past 30 years she has been involved with business. Presently she is selling rice, bread, biscuits, pepper, and other items. 

The problem that she is facing is that the transportation cost is too high. She likes her business because it provides for her needs. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, bread, biscuits, pepper, and other items to expand her business. Her plans are to educate all her children and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, bread, biscuits, pepper, and other items to expand her business

loans.name: Mujeres De Progreso 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Paulina is one of the members of the group Mujeres de Progreso (Women in progress) 1, 2 & 3. This group is located in a rural community surrounded by sugarcane fields in the outskirts of San Pedro de Macoris. She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. For the past six years she has operated a grocery stall where she serves her customers and sells different products. She started her business with her own capital after saving for a while.

Paulina is excited to be a part of this third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan portions and grown her business. She plans to use her loan to invest by buying grocery products. Paulina says that her most difficult challenges are improving her business and helping her family. Nevertheless, she plans to continue enjoying working in her business. Paulina thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy groceries like candies, snacks and others.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Phoebe is a 27-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 6 months to 6 years. She describes herself to be an optimistic woman. She operates a retail store where she sells household-use items. Her business is located at a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 8700 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her six family members. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 40-year-old married woman with four children. She describes herself to be an intelligent woman. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes she makes. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 8,700 KES loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her family members for household chores. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu is 30 years old and lives near Airport, Liberia. She was unable to attend school and is married with three children between 4 and 10 years old that are in school. Her husband is a driver. 

For the past twelve years, Bendu has been selling oil, rice, flour, sugar, bread, sardines etc. She started this business by selling for her oldest sister and learned this trade from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice, flour, sugar, bread, and sardines for her business. Her plan is to build a home and sent her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, flour, sugar, bread, and sardines for her business

loans.name: Banco Comunal Cristo Rey Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Cristo Rey, está conformado por 8 integrantes de los cuales 7 son mujeres y un varón. Personas responsables, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación. Estos integrantes  pertenecen a la comunidad del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Y se caracteriza por ser un lugar productor de leche y sus derivados. Aracelis es la coordinadora del banco comunal la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad de las cuotas en tiempo y forma de cada uno de los integrantes. Ella tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una tienda donde vende  en cantidades pequeñas y productos comestibles como: jugos, gaseosas, pan,  sobre se shapoo, sobre de café, arroz, frijoles, pan, leche, azúcar, huevos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos. El banco comunal Cristo Rey agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: The "Cristo Rey" communal bank is comprised of eight members, seven of whom are women and one is a man. They're responsible, hardworking people with a lot of drive to succeed. These members belong to the community of Sauce, which is located in the northern area of the country and is known for its milk and dairy production. Aracelis is the communal bank's coordinator and she's responsible for each of the members' repayments in terms of time and form. Her business is a grocery store located in her own house. It's a store where she sells small quantities of products and foodstuffs such as juice, soft drinks, bread, shampoo packets, coffee packets, rice, beans, milk, sugar and eggs. The purpose of this loan is to get working capital and stock up her business by purchasing goods for selling. The "Cristo Rey" communal bank thanks the lenders for the help they provide for people of limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have an honest means of livelihood.

loans.use: to get working capital, to stock up her grocery store and to purchase goods such as shampoo packets, coffee packets, rice, beans, bread, milk, sugar and eggs for selling.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Solomon. He is married to a businesswoman and has four children ages 19, 15, 13 and 11 years; all are school-going children.  He has one additional dependent, his younger sister's daughter, who came to live with him to attend school as his sister is living in the village. 

In 1992, Solomon established his essential drugs business. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,300,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. 

Solomon has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and he now requires a new loan in order to purchase  glucose powder, dexorange, septrin syrup, Is Cof S detol, and multivitamin syrups. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  

In the future, Solomon plans to open a laboratory, open another drug store and educate his children very well.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase glucose powder, dexorange, septrin syrup, Is Cof S detol, and  multivitamin syrups

loans.name: Bakr

texts.en: Bakr is a 23-year-old young man who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He is a secondary school graduate. Two years ago, Bakr opened a small drinking water purification station with the help of his late father. He now supplies grocery stores with 5 liter containers of water. Baker is the head of his family after the death of his father. He works very hard and  does his best to provide his mother and little brothers and sisters with everything they need. The drinking water purification system in his station is old and needs to be replaced with a modern one; therefore, he asked for a loan of 200.000YER to buy a new drinking water purification system. Bakr hopes that his small drinking water purification station will make more profits and in turn, help him to improve the standard of living of his family

loans.use: to buy a drinking water purification system

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is 48 years old and lives in the town of Vanadzor with her son and daughter (in the photo).
Her daughter Astghik studies at Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute, named after Hovhannes Tumanyan in the department of pedagogy and psychology. As Armine is the only breadwinner in the family and she supports her children without a husband or any other support, it is very difficult for her to cover family's basic costs and at the same time save money for Astghik's education. So, Armine has applied for this loan to pay for her daughter’s university tuition.
The loan is very important for Armine to pay for university tuition and give her children an opportunity to get higher education.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba is a 39-year-old lady who lives in Airport, Liberia. She is married with three children between 9 and 17. The children are in school and live at home. Kumba is a high school graduate and has been involved in the sales of body cream, powder, spry, and bath soap for 10 years. Her husband helped her to start her business. The business helps them to earn a living for for her children.

Kumba is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, powder, spry, and bath soap for her business. She hopes to build a house and educate her children in business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, powder, spry, and bath soap for her business

loans.name: Nery Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Nery Alejandro esta casado, tiene 29 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica al tejido de cortes típicos, en varios diseños y colores, inicio este negocio con poco capital y por iniciativa propia, hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien  se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de hilos, con el fin de aumentar su producción, y mejorar su posibilidades de vender y tener mejores ganancias. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande y prospero.
texts.en:
Nery Alejandro is a 29 year-old married man. He studied through 6th grade of primary school. He has two children, one of which is studying. He makes a living weaving traditional skirts, in various designs and colors. He started this business with a small amount of capital and by his own initiative. He now has four years of experience. He is supported by his wife, who is responsible for the household duties.

He has requested a loan which he will use to buy thread, with the goal of increasing his production and improving his possibilities of selling, which will increase his profits. He hopes that in the future he will have a big and prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy thread to weave traditional skirts.

loans.name: Marry

texts.en:
Marry is a 48-year-old widow left with three children. For the past nine years, Marry runs a poultry farm with a monthly income of KES. 6500. 

She is applying for her third loan with KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy more poultry feed and chicks for her business.

She hopes to expand her business to help educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and chicks for rearing

loans.name: Hudson

texts.en:
Hudson is a 54-year-old married man. He has 7 children with ages ranging from 4 to twenty-three years. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a retail store where he sells charcoal and has been involved in this business for 2 years. 

Hudson's business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock of charcoal to sell. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy charcoal to sell. His business goal is to run a new retail shop within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 32-year-old, married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be hard-working. 

Pamela operates a food stall where she sells fish. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Pamela will use the KES 15,600 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her family members. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). She intends to complete installing her water tank within two weeks, following delivery.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: La Fe 1, 7, 8 Group

texts.en:
Paula is a member of the group called La Fe (Faith) 1, 7 & 8. This group is located in the city of Samana, in a rural community surrounded by mountains and the Atlantic Ocean. These fifteen entrepreneurs are running their businesses in their community or in other communities nearby.

Paula is selling silver jewelry and accessories for women, an she wants to use this loan to buy more chains, rings, bracelets, and many other different pieces to sell. In the future she wants to continue working in order to overcome the difficulties in her life. By working hard in her business and after five loans, it has been possible to grow her business and expand her clientele. Paula told us that she is working hard because she wants to have a successful business and to save for her future plans.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and accessories for women.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 28 years old and lives near Airport, Liberia, with her three children between the ages of 4 and 12, who are in school and live at home. For the past 7 years, Marie has been running a shop where she sells slippers, fabric, and body cream in the local market. One problem she faces is the high cost of transportation. She says she makes a lot of profits because she is one of those who sells a quality product. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her. She is requesting a loan to buy more slippers, fabric, and body cream for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more slippers, fabric, and body cream for her business.

loans.name: Kahuna Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Margret is a member of the above-mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan. 

She is a fifty-year-old hardworking woman with nine children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a retail shop and she started the business in order to supplement her tea plantation which is seasonal. 

Unpredictable weather changes and bad debtors pose a challenge to her business excellence while her plan is to own a wholesale shop. Florence intends to use the loan facility to buy sugar, salt, soap, match boxes and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, soap, match boxes and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a thirty-three-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. Five years ago, he decided to venture into the sale of cassava flour in order to increase his income sources. He also sells fish to supplement the business and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children.

He lacks permanent operational premises as he moves from one market place to the other and has inadequate capital to meet the high demand. His dream is to own permanent business premises. Gerald intends to use the loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet used the previous loan to buy sugar and soap to sell and renovate her house. She still owns a retail shop in addition to growing onions and bananas. 

Her challenge in this business is price fluctuations and inflation, unpredictable weather changes and customers not paying on time. Her dream is to educate her children and diversify her business to a wholesale shop. Harriet intends to use the loan to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a thirty-five-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for nine years and he got initial capital from coffee farming.

He has challenges of price fluctuation and inadequate capital to meet the high demand. His personal goal is to educate his children up to the University while his business plan is to set up a wholesale shop.

Ezekiel intends to use the loan to buy sheets of iron, cement and mattresses to sell.

loans.use: to buy sheets of iron, cement and mattresses to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 32-year-old ambitious woman with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She operates a bar and with the proceeds she was able to build rental houses from which she now earns extra income. 

As the good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the University. High license and rental fees affect her business growth while her dream is to own a five star hotel. Florence is requesting a loan to buy beer, whiskey and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers, whiskey and soda to sell.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en: Micheal is a 31-year-old married man with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a stationery shop for four years and also earns a monthly salary as a teacher. His major clients are students and offices, and he is, thus, assured of business all year round. His challenges include insufficient electricity supply and high labor turnover. His dreams are to own a standby generator and to diversify his businesses to include motorcycle transport. Micheal intends to use the loan to buy a motorcycle for a transportation business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for a transportation business.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina  de 30 años, está casada con Emilio. Ambos tienen 1 hijo. Ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en un distrito agrícola.
Ella muestra una actitud pasiva pero es una mujer de gran coraje y fuera. Con mucha actitud se dirige a los campos cada mañana, ya que su actividad es la agricultura.  Sus principales productos constan de papas, arvejas y maíz. Una de sus más grandes satisfacciones es ver sus resultados cuando negocia sus productos en la ciudad de Tarma. Para agilizar su trabajo en el campo contrata operarios a quienes paga cada día, por labrar, cosechar y cargar los pesados sacos. Las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de sus productos naturales son regulares, por eso quiere ampliar sus cultivos y obtener más ingresos, así estaría asegurárnosles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 
Las lluvias y los suelos fértiles le darán un buen resultado en sus cultivos de papas y arvejas que piensa realizar éste mes; confía en ello. Requiere de su apoyo para tal efecto. Éste es su crédito número 12 con MFP. Está muy agradecida por la confianza de tantos años de trabajo. Además es una socia puntual y responsable dentro de su banco comunal “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay”.
Destinará los 2500 soles en la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos para sus cultivos de maíz, además semillas de arvejas.
texts.en:
Delfina is 30 years old. She's married to Emilio and they have a son together. They live in a house of their own which is located in a rural district.
She displays a passive attitude, but she's a woman of great courage and strength. One of her biggest satisfactions is to see the results she gets when she sells her produce in the town of Tarma. In order to speed up her agricultural work, she hires day laborers whom she pays to till, harvest and carry the heavy sacks. The profits she obtains from selling her produce are average, and therefore she wishes to expand her crop and increase her earnings. That way she would be ensuring better living conditions for her family.
She trusts that the rains and the fertile soils will yield good results for the potato and pea crops that she intends to sow this month. She asks for your support in order to do that. This is her 12th loan with MFP. She's very thankful for the trust and so many years of work. In addition, she's a very punctual and responsible member of her communal bank "Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay" ("Beautiful Sunrise of Cumutay").
She will use the 2500 soles to purchase organic fertilizers for her corn crops, and to purchase pea seeds.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers for her corn crops, and also to purchase pea seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en: Cleophas used his previous loan to buy sugar, rice, and soap to sell. He is a forty-three-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese,Uganda. His hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goal is to educate his children, while his business goal is to expand his business to new markets. Cleophas intends to use the money to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 33 años, convive con Javier con quien tiene 3 hijos. Esta familia vive unida y contenta en una casa propia, ubicada en una zona agrícola.
La responsabilidad e inteligencia son unas de sus más sobresalientes virtudes.  Gracias a los suelos fértiles de su zona, se dedica a la agricultura. Lleva como 10 años en esta actividad, el mismo tiempo que lleva con su pareja. Por eso, los dos se hacen responsables del cultivo de arvejas, lechugas y papas, de distintas variedades. 
“La venta de hortalizas como arvejas, habas, y verduras es rentable, porque los productos son requeridos desde otras ciudades”, afirma entusiasta.
Lleva una buena relación con su pareja, quien la apoya en todas las actividades agrícolas. Mientras Javier se encuentra en el campo, Nilda le lleva los alimentos, para él y para los peones. Así es la manera de trabajo, a la que se acostumbró. 
Por eso, en cada cosecha obtiene los resultados de su esfuerzo: buenas ventas. 
Enero y febrero son meses importantes para la siembra de arvejas y papas, gracias a las lluvias, por ello solicita de su ayuda para adquirir fertilizantes y semillas.
Éste es su crédito número 6 con MFP y además pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de Cumutay”, ella es la tesorera eficiente, por ello se compromete en cumplir con los pagos y con las reuniones de su grupo.
Destinará  los 2000 soles en la compra de 4 bolsas de semillas de arvejas. Considera que tendrá un sobrante de 300 soles, los que empleará para adquirir fertilizantes orgánicos.
texts.en:
Nilda is 33 years old and lives with Javier, with whom she has 3 children.  This family lives together happily in their own home, which is located in the agricultural zone.  

Responsibility and intelligence are some of her most outstanding virtues.  Thanks to the fertile soil in her area, she earns a living with agriculture.  She has been performing this activity for 10 years, which is the same amount of time that she has been with her partner.  For that reason, both of them have become responsible for the cultivation of different varieties of peas, lettuce and potatoes.  

“The sale of vegetables such as peas, beans, and other vegetables is profitable because the products are required by other cities,” she affirms enthusiastically. 

She has a good relationship with her partner, who supports her in all the agricultural activities.  While Javier is in the field, Nilda brings food for him and for the farm hands.  Such is the way of work to which she is accustomed.  So in every harvest she obtains the results of her efforts: good sales.  

January and February are important months for planting peas and potatoes, thanks to the rains.  For this reason, she is requesting your help to acquire fertilizers and seeds.  This is her sixth loan with MFP and she also belongs to the communal bank “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay” [Beautiful Cumutay Dawn].  She is the efficient treasurer; therefore, she promises to complete the payments and to attend the meetings of the group. 

The 2000 soles will be used to buy 4 bags of pea seeds.  She estimates that she will have 300 soles left over, which she will use to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of pea seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Banco Mujer Emprendedoras
Fray Casiano, Puntarenas
2013-006

	Banco Mujer Emprendedoras presenta la solicitud de crédito, por segunda oportunidad, está conformado por 10 mujeres,  quienes han trabajado desde hace 8 años como grupo organizado en Fray Casiano, zona  de alta pobreza en Puntarenas. Han  demostrando buen manejo de los conceptos de trabajo grupal (solidaridad, ahorro y además de coordinar actividades generando fondos),  tiene reglas claras de trabajo. Ellas han solicitado préstamos y conocen la modalidad de trabajo grupal.  Se forma la Junta Directiva y se levanta el acta No.2 para la solicitud de este préstamo y la integración de 3 nuevas compañeras y la salida de 2 del crédito anterior del Banco Mujer Emprendedoras.

 
	 Su trabajo y  esfuerzo les ha permitido tener la actividad de comercio ambulante  mejor consolidada, situación que se corrobora en la visita realizada a cada una de las solicitantes. 

Yesenia, integrante del grupo, invertirán su crédito  en la compra de sandalias, ropa, artículos de belleza y mercadería en general, incrementando su inventario  y cubriendo pedidos para la época de vacaciones y los carnavales de Puntarenas que estan por iniciar en el mes de Febrero, siendo una gran oportunidad para las ventas. Además, realizan ventas de comida y rifas que les permiten incrementar su ahorro y apoyar a sus familia en los gastos del hogar y estudio de los hijos, ya que la de las integrantes son madres solteras y jefas de hogar y su aporte económico es muy importante para la calidad de vida de ellas y la de sus hijos e hijas. 

	Yesenia es una  mujer muy luchadora y gracias a la organización interna del grupo logra realizar  la recuperación de la cuota en forma semanal,  lo que les permite tener un margen más amplio para la obtención del dinero para el pago. Ella es la presidenta, la  consideran una buena líder  y   esperan contar con esté préstamo para seguir creciendo cada día.

	Son mujeres luchadoras, que por medio de la organización han logrado superarse y mejorar los ingresos de sus familias, apoyando  el estudio a sus hijos y a sus parejas contribuyendo  en la economía familiar.
texts.en:
Banco Mujer Emprendedoras
Fray Casiano, Puntarenas
2013-006

The Mujer Emprendedoras [Entrepreneurial Women] communal bank presents their second loan request.  The bank is comprised of ten women who have worked together as an organized group in Fray Casiano for eight years. This is an area of Puntarenas with a high level of poverty. These women have demonstrated a good grasp of the concepts of group work (solidarity, savings, and coordinating activities to generate income) and have clear work rules. They have requested loans and know the discipline of group work.

They have a board of directors, and the documents were prepared to request this loan, to have three new colleagues join, and to have two members from the previous loan to the Mujer Emprendedoras leave the communal bank.

Their hard work and effort has allowed each of them to be better street merchants; this fact was evidenced during a visit with each one of the members.

Yesenia, a group member, will invest this loan in the purchase of sandals, clothing, beauty products, and general merchandise.  She will be increasing her inventory and covering orders for the vacation season and the Puntarenas Carnavales, which start in the month of February.  This is a great sales opportunity.  

These women also sell food and raffle tickets, which allow them to increase their savings and support their families by covering household costs and their children's education. The majority are single mothers, the heads of their households, and their economic contributions are very important for their quality of life and that of their sons and daughters.

Yesenia is a very tenacious woman, and thanks to the group's internal organization she manages to pay back the loan weekly.  This allows the group to have more leeway in getting the money for the payment.

She is the president, and the members consider her to be a good leader.  They hope to get this loan in order to continue growing each day.

They are hard-working women. Through their organization they have been able to succeed and improve their families' incomes, support their children's studies, and help their life partners by contributing to the household finances.

loans.use: to buy sandals, clothing, beauty products, and general merchandise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
Zenovia tiene 65 años y es viuda. Sus hijos ya salieron de su hogar. Ella vive sola en una casa propia que construyó de joven con su esposo y se ubica en un distrito agrícola.
A pesar de su edad, Zenovia trabaja como una mujer joven. Su edad no es impedimento para dedicarse a una actividad muy cansada, la agricultura.
 Los suelos de su zona son propicios para la siembra de arveja, papa, maíz y algunas hortalizas, por eso aprovecha al máximo cada temporada para producir. 
“Me gusta mi trabajo, porque me siento libre caminando por las quebradas y montes con mis animales y cuidando mis cultivos”, dice.
Ella aprovecha su tiempo desde que los primeros rayos del sol alumbran la mañana, así puede asegurar el cuidado de todos sus productos. Lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces cuando no les brinda un tratamiento adecuado a sus cultivos, se infectan con plagas y recuerda con tristeza como alguna  vez perdió casi toda su producción, pero con la experiencia que le dio la vida, continúa trabajando. 
Éste mes tiene pensado contratar peones y sembrar semillas de arvejas. Para esto necesita de su apoyo.
Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de Cumutay”, y le agrada la modalidad de trabajo. Éste sería su crédito número 12 con MFP, está muy agradecida por la confianza hacia su persona por tanto tiempo.
Con los 1000 soles podrá adquirir una bolsa de semillas de arvejas y además podrá pagar el servicio de los peones que contratará.
texts.en:
Zenovia, 65, is a widow.  Her children have left home already.  She lives alone in her own house in an agricultural area.  She built it with her husband when she was young.  Zenovia works like a young woman despite her age.  Her age is not an impediment to making a living in a very tiring job, agriculture.

The soil in the region is favorable for growing peas, potatoes, corn, and some vegetables, so she makes the most of every growing season.  "I like my job because I feel free walking through the arroyos and hills with my animals and tending to my crops," she says.  She makes the most of her time as soon as the first rays of the sun illuminate the morning so she can be certain to take care of all of her crops.

What she doesn't like is that many times when she doesn't give her crops adequate treatment they get infected with pests.  She remembers sadly how once she lost almost her entire crop.  With the experience that life gave her, though, she keeps on working.

This month she plans to hire laborers and plant pea seeds, for which she needs your help.  She belongs to Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay Communal Bank and she likes the type of work.  This would be her twelfth loan with MFP.  She's grateful for the trust in her for such a long time.

With the 1000 soles [PEN] she'll be able to get a bag of pea seeds and pay for the service of the laborers she's going to hire.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and to hire laborers

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni de 29 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Eduardo y de su pequeño hijo Luis. Ésta familia habita un hogar cálido ubicado en un distrito rural.
Es suspicaz y atenta, por eso supo aprender lo necesario de sus padres para dedicarse a la agricultura. Cuando formó su propia familia empezó a trabajar junto a su esposo, quien la apoya en el trabajo tan cansado. “El trabajo es muy cansado y absorbente, sembramos papas y arvejas, en terrenos que están a gran distancia”, menciona. 
Por eso debe levantarse de madrugada para alcanzar los primeros rayos solares del día. 
Por su parte, Eduardo ya lleva un año trabajando como peón en una empresa constructora, que le brinda ingresos mensuales fijos. 
Así trabaja Marleni, quien no descuida a su pequeño hijo, a quien atiende con esmero y amor. 
Sus sembríos de maíz necesitan de fertilizantes, además requiere de semillas para iniciar otra siembra de arvejas. Solicita de su apoyo. Su banco comunal se llama “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay”, donde es una socia muy puntual y responsable. Éste es su crédito número 12 con MFP. Se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo de tantos años. Marleni podrá comprar 3 bolsas de semillas de arvejas para iniciar una siembra, además de bolsas de fertilizantes para otros cultivos.
texts.en:
Twenty-nine year old Marleni lives in her own house, in the company of her husband, Eduardo, and her little son, Luis.  This family inhabits a warm home located in the rural district.  

She is curious and watchful so she learned what was necessary from her parents in order to earn a living from agriculture.  

When she formed her own family, she began to work together with her husband, who supports her in the very tiring work.  “The work is very tiring and demanding.  We plant potatoes and peas in fields that are far away,” she mentions.  So she must wake up very early to catch the day’s first rays of sun.  

As for his part, Eduardo has already been working for a year as a laborer in a construction company which provides a fixed monthly income.  

That is the way Marleni works, not neglecting her son, whom she attends with care and love.  

Her cornfields need fertilizers and in addition she needs seeds to start another crop of peas.  She is asking for your help.  Her community bank is called “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay” [Beautiful Cumutay Dawn], where she is a very punctual and responsible member.  This is her 12th loan with MFP.  She feels very grateful for the support for so many years.  Marleni will be able to buy 3 bags of pea seeds to start planting in addition to bags of fertilizers for other crops.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of pea seeds to start a planting, in additon to bags of fertilizers for other crops.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 59 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, es soltera y vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo, su nuera y su nieto a quien ayuda a criar y educar. El trabajo de María es la compra y venta de pescado, caminando por la calle distribuye a sus caseros su producto, el cual compra a precios muy accesibles. Ella tiene muchos clientes, ya que vende el pescado más fresco y sabroso del mercado y es una vendedora muy alegre, que siempre saca a sus clientes una sonrisa. Dependiendo de la temporada, ofrece a la venta sardinas, palometas, bagres, paiche, doncella u otros. Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad recorriendo las calles de la ciudad de palmo a palmo. Le gusta su trabajo por que puede conversar con sus clientes y bromear con ellos, además que le genera buenas ganancias ya que siempre tiene ventas considerables, al principio cuando se inició con este trabajo le era muy complicado ya que tenia no sabia como conservar el pescado que no lograba vender y todo lo que echaba a perder y perdía su inversión, pero con el tiempo logro aprender y ahora le esta yendo mucho mejor, espera tener en el futuro un pequeño frigorífico donde pueda vender sus pescados sin temor a que se malogren por el intenso calor del sol. Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que así se siente mas segura de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual ya que no desea dejar una mala impresión sobre sí frente a los miembros de su grupo.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará más pescado, ya que últimamente esta teniendo mayor demanda y desea ampliar la variedad de especies.
texts.en:
María, 59 years old, is a very friendly and hardworking woman. She is single and lives in her own house with her son, her daughter-in-law, and grandson and she helps to raise and educate him.

Maria’s work is buying and selling fish, walking through the street distributing her product to the inhabitants, which she buys at very affordable prices. She has many customers, as she sells the freshest and most delicious fish from the market and she is a very friendly saleswoman, who always gives her customers a smile. Depending on the season she offers sardines, pompano, catfish, paiche, doncella or others.

She has being doing this work for 30 years walking the city streets inch by inch. She likes her work because she can talk with her customers and joke with them, and also she makes a good income as she always has considerable sales. At first when she began this work it was very complicated as she did not know how to preserve the fish that she had not been able to sell and throwing it out at a loss and losing her investment, but over time she learned and now she is doing much better. She hopes to have a little refrigerator in the future where she can sell her fish without feat that it will spoil in the intense heat of the sun.

This is the third loan through MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support as she feels more secure going ahead in her business, and she promises once more to complete the payments punctually as she does not want to leave a bad impression about herself in front of the members of her group.

With the requested amount of 2000 soles, she will buy more fish, because recently she has been having a greater demand and she wants to expand her variety of fish.

loans.use: to buy more fish as recently she has been having a greater demand and she wants to buy more variety of fish

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es: Empanadas, salchichas, con papas, arepas con huevos, empanadas, picadas y patacones, son los principales productos,  que Ana vende desde hace 2 años, en su pequeño negocio, ubicado en su domicilio al suroccidente de la ciudad, donde habita con su esposo y tiene 3 hijos adultos. Emprendiendo esta actividad, logró dar rienda suelta a su aptitud por la cocina, responder a las necesidades potenciales de su barrio y generar ingresos para apoyar el bienestar de su hogar. Ana trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las 5 de la mañana,  hasta las 9 de la noche cuando se va su último cliente. Su meta es ampliar la estructura de negocios y hacer mejoras locativas que le proporcionen más confort a sus clientes y a ella en su diario trabajo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos para preparar picadas encargadas, como harina de trigo, aceite, salsas, cárnicos, huevos, azúcar, sal etc. Su inversión planea ser exitosa, porque la hará en mayor volumen y de contado, lo que le ayudará a conseguir precios especiales y así mismo vender con mejores opciones para su fiel clientela. Esta es justamente la razón de éxito de su credikiva, pues su capacidad de trabajo y experiencia en el mercado fortalecen su potencial emprendedor.
texts.en:
"Empanadas" [pies], sausage and potatoes, "arepas" [corn cakes] with eggs, snacks, and fried plantains are the main dishes Ana has sold for two years in her small business located in her home in the southwestern part of the city, where she lives with her husband and three adult children.  By carrying out this work she managed to give free rein to her cooking aptitude, respond to the potential needs of her neighborhood, and generate income to support the well-being of her household.

Ana works from Monday to Sunday from 5 in the morning until her last customer leaves at 9 at night.  Her goal is to expand her business structure and make site improvements that will make her customers and her more comfortable in her daily work.

Currently she's applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she'll buy supplies to make snacks on request, such as wheat flour, oil, sauces, meat, eggs, sugar, salt, etc.

Her investment should be successful because she'll make it in quantity and in cash, which will help her get special prices and also offer her loyal customers better choices.  This is precisely the reason for the success of her Kiva loan, because her capacity for work and her experience in the market strengthen her entrepreneurial potential.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, oil, sauces, meat, eggs, sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and soda to sell.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is a 42-year-old single mother of five children living in Kasese, Uganda. She used her previous loan to buy general merchadise to sell. She has been in the retail shop business for four years. She started with 400,000 UGX and now has 5,000,000 UGX as working capital. Her hardship is customers not paying on time. Her personal goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to own a wholesale shop. Charity intends to use the money from this loan to buy sugar, soap and water to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and water to sell.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman is twenty-seven years old, married, and has a one year old child. He has no additional dependents. 

In 2002, Osman established his business selling drinks, biscuits, milk, cell phones, and top-up cards. He began his business because he wanted to generate income to enroll in a university. His business is located in the outskirts of Freetown. His primary customers are people that live in his community. 

Osman works seven days a week and seventeen hours each day. He earns about 900,000 SLL each month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL to buy more drinks, milk, and cell phone recharge cards to resell. In the future, Osman plans to establish another store within his community. He will use the funds to educate his child. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy beverages, milk, and cell phone recharge cards to sell.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is forty-nine years old and married. He has four children, who are ages eight, fourteen, sixteen, and twenty-one. He has an additional four dependents who live with him and assist him with his business. 

In 2002, Wilfred established his charcoal and wood business. He began his business because there was unmet demand for the type of services he provides. Wilfred works eleven hours a day, seven days a week. He earns about 1,970,000 SLL each month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL to purchase more firewood for his business. 

In the future, Wilfred plans to erect his own house and send his children to university. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood for his business.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia tiene 47 años, vive con Juan, con quien tiene 7 hijos; pero solo vive con 5 de sus hijos ya que los otros 2 son independientes. Su casa es propia y se ubica en un distrito rural.
Empeño, responsabilidad y constancia, son unos de sus más saltantes valores. Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 23 años. Con la ayuda de su esposo, siembra papas, arvejas, maíz y flores de gladiolo, y aunque afirma que el trabajo debe ser muy dedicado, durante todos los días vigila con paciencia sus campos, hasta la espera de la cosecha, mientras cuida a sus animales como: vacas, toros, ovejas y cerdos.
Las cosechas es otra actividad muy cansada por eso tiene que contratar personas para agilizar este trabajo.
Ella es una mujer que no se cansa fácilmente, porque también cría animales y prepara platos de comida en la feria de su distrito. 
Y como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad para mejorar sus ganancias, especialmente arvejas ya que la demanda se mantiene en cada mes del año. 
“Éste mes tendré que sembrar arvejas y maíz, y se cosechará a partir de junio”, menciona entusiasta. 
Para ello, requiere de su apoyo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de Cumutay” y este sería su préstamo número 12 con MFP, donde promete que será muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, además está contenta con el trabajo en su banco comunal por los ahorros en equipo.
Ella invertirá el dinero en la compra de semillas de arvejas y maíz, así como un poco de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Basilia is 47 years old. She lives with Juan, with whom she has seven children. However, she only lives with five of her children as the other two are independent. Her house is her own, and is located in a rural area. 

Determination responsibility and perseverance are some of her most outstanding values. She has worked in agriculture for 23 years. With her husband's help, she sows potatoes, peas, corn and gladiolus flowers. Although she affirms that the work is very demanding, every day she patiently looks after her fields, until the prospect of the harvest, while she cares for her animals, such as cows, bulls, sheep and pigs. 

The harvest is another very tiring activity, and so she has to hire people to speed up this work. 

She is a woman who does not tire easily, because she also raises animals and prepares food dishes for her district fair. And as she is an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to sow in greater quantity in order to increase her earnings, especially peas, as demand is is constant every month of the year. 

 "This month I will have to sow peas and corn, and they will be harvested from June", she mentions, enthusiastic. 

For that, she needs your support. She belongs to the communal bank "Lindo amanecer de Cumutay" and this will be her 12th loan with MFP, where she promises to be very punctual in the payment of her instalments. She is happy with the work in her communal bank from the team savings.

She will invest the money in the purchase of pea and corn seeds, as well as some fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy pea and corn seeds, as well as some fertilizers

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
Luis de  58  años de edad, originario de León,  soltero,  padre de 4 hijos, ya  mayores, actualmente solo 1 está estudiando, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de taller de mecánica. Inicio su negocio hace 32 años, con capital propio, del cual ha podido obtener ingresos extra, él se siente satisfecho porque este negocio de taller de mecánica,  le genera ganancias a diarios ya que él cuenta  con clientes fijos, este ha sido su primer negocio, sus expectativas es mejorar la infraestructura de su taller, para tener más clientela y brindar un mejor servicio.
Luis está solicitando el préstamo para  comprar aceite para carro, tornillo, luces para carro,  etc. Ya que el estima que con este crédito  le será de mucha  ayuda porque podrá comprar  toda la materia prima que necesita en su taller, con el propósito de obtener mejores utilidades en su negocio y mejor la estabilidad familiar, sus planes futuros es  mejorar la infraestructura del local en donde tiene su taller para darle una mejor presentación.
texts.en:
Luis, 58 years old, is from León. He is single and has four children, who are now grown, just one is still studying Business. Luis makes a living working in his repair shop. He began this business 32 years ago, with his own capital and it has since been profitable. He is very satisfied because this repair shop allows him daily earnings since he has some loyal customers. This is Luis' first business, and he expects to improve his shop's infrastructure in order to attract more customers and offer them better service. 

Luis is requesting this loan in order to buy motor oil, screws, headlights, etc. He considers this loan to be a big help to his business because he will be able to buy the basic materials he needs in the shop. With the goal of providing better services to his customers and building a reputation based on this, his plan for the future is to improve the infrastructure of his shop so that it has a better presentation.

loans.use: to buy motor oil, screws, headlights, etc.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has four children aged 19, 17, 12 and 7. In 2007, Fatmata established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed a reliable livelihood. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,100,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 6,000,000 SLL. 

Fatmata requires a loan to purchase more clothing for her business.  In the future, Fatmata plans to open another business location, educate her children and build her own house.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her business

loans.name: Maire

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Maria.  She is married and has 2 children aged 14 and 11 yrs old. In 2000, Maria established her commercial business in cotton clothing of differing quality. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 700,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 6,000,000 SLL. 

Maria requires a loan to purchase different types of clothing for her business.  In the future, Maria plans to increase her profits and build her own cold room and educate her children to the university level.  She is thankful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her business.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Composé de 2 veuves et de 2 mariées les femmes du groupe  Sabougnouma  qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 4 enfants vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré  à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales, d’habits, de tasses, de tubercules et de l’arachide. 
Awa, qui est assise papier en main fait l’achat vente de céréales. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, 600 kilos de maïs auprès des paysans des villages voisins de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités, pour les frais de santé et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Composed of two widows and two married women, the members of the group Sabougnouma average 39 years of age and four children each, living for the most part in traditional families in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni City. The women know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity, so as to do better business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third loan. This group of women does commerce in grains, clothing, basins, tubers, and peanuts. 

Awa, who is seated in the photo with paper in hand, sells grains. She intends to use her loan to purchase 600 kg of corn from peasant farmers from villages neighboring Bougouni. She makes her sales retail at the market and from home. She accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used for: investing in her business, covering healthcare costs, and paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Pathmos Group

texts.fr: La cliente Katungu est conseillère du groupe d’affaire Patmos, entrepreneur, couturière et sociétaire d’un atelier de coupe et couture. Elle est âgée d’environ 32 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Son mari est un enseignant dans une école primaire. Cette cliente vend également les matériels de couture. Apres, sa formation dans un centre professionnel, vers les années 2000, elle a commencé à exercer de petits jobs et au fil du temps, elle se constituait  un petit fonds de démarrage. Ce nouveau prêt doit lui servir de s’approvisionner tissus, papier, popeline, tirette, mordoré, etc. Elle ambitionne améliorer son atelier. En le modernisant.  Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour accompagnement aux petits entrepreneurs. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
This client, Katungu, is the advisor of the business group Patmos. She is an entrepreneur, a clothier, and a partner in a fashion shop. She is about 32 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Her husband is teacher in a primary school. This client also sells sewing supplies. After her training in a professional center, she began to do small jobs around the year 2000, and over the course of time, she built up a small start-up fund for herself. 

This new loan must serve to supply her with cloth, paper, poplin, pulls, bronze items, etc. Her ambition is to improve her shop by modernizing it. So, she thanks Hekima for support small-scale entrepreneurs. 

It should be noted that some clients in the photo are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, paper, poplin, pulls, bronze items, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Barra Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées les femmes du groupe  Barra  qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 2 enfants vivent majoritairement dans des familles nucléaires dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré  à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de cosmétiques, d’habits, de boucles d’oreilles, de parfums,de chaussures et de l’artisanat. 
Djénéba, qui est assise devant papier en main fait l’achat vente de chaussures. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, 250 paires de chaussures de différentes sortes auprès des grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités, pour les frais de santé et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
All of them married, the women of the group Barra average 33 years of age and two children each, living for the most part in nuclear families in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni City. The women know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity, so as to do better business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third loan. This group of women does commerce in cosmetics, clothing, earrings, perfumes, shoes, and arts & crafts. 

Djénéba, who is seated in front in the photo with papers in hand, buys and sells shoes. She intends to use her loan to purchase 250 pairs of shoes of different kinds from Bougouni wholesalers. She makes her sales retail at the market and from home. She accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used for: investing in her business, covering healthcare costs, and paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Magaly De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Magaly tiene la edad de 49 años de edad, originaria de Granada, viuda, madre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 15 y 21 años respectivamente el cual uno de ello esta estudiando en la universidad, de oficio comerciante se dedica al negocio de una mini pulpería. Inicio su actividad laboral con capital propio, dinero que le daba su marido, del cual es dueña hace mas de 16 años, luego miro que necesitaba mas ingreso para invertir en su negocio, fue allí que decidió pedir un pequeño préstamo a una institución financiera para poder sacar adelante su negocio de pulpería, ella cuenta con otros ingresos como es el alquiler de unos cuartos que tiene, sus expectativas es ampliar su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias.
Magaly solicita el financiamiento para comprar toda la mercadería en general como gaseosa, arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara,ya que se acerca la temporada buena en donde la demanda de su producto crece aun mas, ya que de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ventas, para tener mejores ingresos, sus planes futuros es poder pagar el préstamo para luego volver a solicitar otro, su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de los cuartos para brindar un mejor servicios a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Magaly is a 49-year-old native of Granada. She is a widow and mother of two children between the ages of 15 and 21. One of them is studying at the university. As a shopkeeper, she works in her small grocery store business. She began her business with her own capital--money that her husband gave her. She has been the owner of her business for more than 16 years. Later, she saw that she needed more income to invest in her business. It was then that she decided to apply for a small loan from a financial institution to progress her small grocery store business. She has other sources of income such as some rooms that she rents out. Her hopes are to increase her business in order to yield better earnings. 

Magaly is requesting this loan to buy general merchandise such as soft drinks, rice, sugar, oil, etc. She estimates that this loan will help her since the good season is approaching in which her business' demand increases. Moreover, in this way she will be able to increase her sales in order to have a better income. Her future plans are to be able to repay the loan to then request another one. Her next goal is to improve the infrastructure of the rooms to provide a better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soft drinks, rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María Auxiliadora es una joven que tiene 20 años de edad, por el momento no trabaja pero está estudiando la carrera de contaduría pública y finanzas con la ayuda de sus padres quienes le pagan la mensualidad de la universidad, ahora ella está por culminar sus estudios por lo que está solicitando apoyo de crédito para poder pagara el curso de titulación de su profesión para ser alguien en la vida y aspirar por un empleo con salario digno para apoyar a sus padres que con tanto sacrificio han hecho que ella este por un paso para terminar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en: María Auxiliadora is a 20 year-old youth who is not currently working.  She is studying for a degree in public accounting and finance with the help of her parents, who pay the monthly university fees.  Now, she is just about to finish her education, and she is requesting the support of this loan so that she can pay for final fees to register her diploma.  This will enable her to make something of herself and aspire to a job with a decent salary so that she can support her parents, who have made so many sacrifices in order for her to be able to take this step to finish her college education.

loans.use: to pay fees to register her college degree

loans.name: Ambekou Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Ambekou  qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, 5 enfants et tous mariés vivent majoritairement dans des familles nucléaires dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré  à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de céréales, d’habits, de tasses, des ustensiles de cuisine, de l’huile alimentaire, des boucles d’oreilles et de l’artisanat. 
Fanta, qui est assise derrière entrain de rire et papier en main fait l’achat vente de céréales. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, 600 kilos de maïs auprès des paysans des villages voisins de Bougouni, les jours de foires. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités, pour les frais de santé, de nourriture et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The members of the group Ambekou are all married and average 48 years of age and five children each, living for the most part in nuclear families in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni City. The women know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity, so as to do better business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third loan. This group of women does commerce in grains, clothing, basins, kitchen utensils, cooking oil, earrings, and arts & crafts. 

Fanta, who is seated in back and laughing with papers in hand, buys and sells grains. She intends to use her loan to purchase 600 kg of corn from peasant farmers in the villages neighboring Bougouni when the fairs take place. She makes her sales retail at the market and from home. She accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 22,500 francs CFA that will be used for: investing in her business, covering healthcare costs, and paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Meylin Juniett

texts.es:
Meylin  de 29 años de edad, originaria La Paz Centro, Municipio de León,  soltera, con conocimiento académico de quinto año de secundaria, es madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de  1, 2 y 6 años respectivamente, actualmente solo uno está estudiando, porque los otros dos todavía no tienen edad para estudiar, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de quesillos. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio desde muy joven, la cual  buscaba  una  fuente de ingreso  para poder sobrevivir con su familia , fue a la edad de 18 años que decidió vender quesillos, negocio que le genera ganancias a diarias, este ha sido su primer negocio, sus expectativas es incrementar sus ventas para obtener mejores ingresos.
Ella está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar quesillo, tortillas, cebolla, cremas, para la elaboración de sus deliciosos quesillos, con el objetivo de hacer crecer su negocio para que le genere mejores utilidades, sus planes futuros es seguir aumentando su producción de venta, su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Meylin, 29 years old, is from La Paz Centro, in the municipality of León. She is single and has a high school education. She is the mother of three children, ages 1, 2, and 6 years old; only one is old enough to go to school.  Meylin makes a living selling quesillos (a typical dish made with tortillas, cheese, and sour cream). She began working as a vendor when she was very young and looking for a way to earn money and help her family survive. When Meylin was 18 years old, she decided to sell quesillos, a business that would generate daily income. 

This is Meylin's first business, and she expects to increase her sales so that she will earn more profits. She is requesting this loan in order to buy cheese, tortillas, onion, and sour cream to make her delicious quesillos. In this way, Meylin hopes to expand her business and provide better service. Her plan for the future is to continue increasing her sales. Her next goal is to improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy cheese, tortillas, onions, and sour cream.

loans.name: Matumaini Group

texts.fr: La cliente Esther, membre du collectif de crédit Matumaini,  jeune femme entrepreneur , dynamique, âgée de 27 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est vendeuses des habits. Elle a commencé son business avec le micro crédit  de Hekima. Elle fut initiée  par sa mère dans cette affaire. Elle expose ses articles dans les camps de militaires auprès de ses pairs, tantôt au marché public de Katindo. Son mari est un officier militaire. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et d’appui à la scolarité de ses enfants. Ce nouveau prêt doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 30 pièces de pagnes. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et ouvrir  un magasin. La cliente remercie Hekima pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes non bancables.
texts.en:
This client, Esther, is a member of the loan collective Matumaini. She is a young woman entrepreneur, 27 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She is a retailer of clothing. She began her business with a Hekima micro-loan. She was introduced to this work by her mother. Esther displays her goods at military camps, along with her peers, and sometimes at the Katindo public market. Her husband is a military officer. 

The profits from her business go toward savings, food, and covering her children's schooling costs. This new loan must serve to provide her with 30 lengths of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). In addition, she would like to see her children grow up and to open a store. 

This client thanks Hekima for its actions helping unbanked poor women to become autonomous.

loans.use: to purchase 30 lengths of 'pagne' cloth.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana, de 40 años, es una amable mujer, emprendedora y muy sociable, se quedó viuda hace algún tiempo pero eso no le impidió para continuar brindándole a su única hija llamada Cindy todo lo necesario para enfrentar la vida, ellas viven en su casa propia compartiendo sus días también al lado de su abuela. Su madre y su hija se han convertido en su único y principal motivo para dar lo mejor de sí en todo lo que realiza para salir adelante.
Juliana tiene como negocio principal la venta de pescado. Durante mucho tiempo vio la manera de sobresalir en este mundo laboralmente competitivo, realizó todo tipo de trabajos hasta que llegó a la actividad a la que ahora se dedica. Se inició con la ayuda de una de sus amigas quien le ofreció un espacio en su puesto del mercado principal de la ciudad y ahí empezó esta travesía. Ahora tiene su propio puesto. Inicialmente sentía que la falta de costumbre generaba que no vendiera lo necesario por si misma, pero el paso del tiempo le ha brindado la suficiente experiencia para lograr jugosas ganancias al finalizar el día. Vende desde hace 12 años y ofrece todo tipo de pescados de todos los tamaños y precios. Inicia su labor a las 4 de la mañana y culmina al llegar el mediodía. Complementa este negocio trabajando por las tardes en su casa vendiendo gaseosas, hielo y eventualmente realizando trabajos de costura como pantalones, camisas y blusas. Su trabajo le permitió tener tiempo para estar al lado de su hija en los momentos más importantes de su vida y eso le genera mayor satisfacción.
Aprendió mucho de todas las experiencias que ha vivido, en su trabajo es muy querida por sus compañeros de local ya que siempre lleva una sonrisa en su rostro y una palabra de aliento para sus amigas, se siente muy feliz generando sus propios ingresos, tiene muchos planes en mente pero por el momento lo que más desea es seguir trabajando y más adelante establecer una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y espera lograrlo en corto tiempo. 
Este es el crédito número 8 con MFP, esta muy contenta y agradecida por el apoyo que está recibiendo que la ayudará a consolidar poco a poco sus objetivos, por otra parte se compromete a continuar pagando sus cuotas de manera puntual y responsable, le agrada pertenecer a su banco comunal el cual es socia fundadora porque sabe que todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará los pescados mas solicitados en la región para continuar vendiendo, su inversión diaria puede llegar hasta 1500 soles dependiendo del tipo de pescado y de la temporada.
texts.en:
Juliana, 40, is a kind, sociable, and enterprising woman.  She was widowed some time ago, but this has not prevented her from continuing to provide her only daughter, Cindy, with everything she needs in life.  They live in their own home, and they also share their days with Cindy's grandmother.  Juliana's mother and daughter have become her main and only motive to give the best of herself in everything she does so that she can get ahead.  Juliana has a business selling fish.

Over a long period of time, she figured out how to succeed in the competitive business world.  She did a lot of types of work before she came to her current occupation.  She started out with the help of one of her friends, who offered her space in her stall in the main market of the city, and this is where she began her journey.  Now, she has her own stall.  At the beginning, she used to feel that due to her lack of experience, she would not be able to sell what she needed to support herself.  However, time has provided her with enough experience that she now earns substantial profits by the end of each day.  She's been selling for 12 years, and she sells fish of all sizes and prices.  She starts her work at 4 in the morning, and finishes by noon.  She complements this business by working in the afternoons selling soft drinks and ice from her house, and she also occasionally does sewing work, making pants, shirts and blouses.  Her work has allowed her to have time to be with her daughter at the most important moments of her life, and this gives her great satisfaction.

Juliana has learned a lot from all of her life experiences.  At her work she is very well-liked by her fellow merchants, because she always has a smile on her face and a word of encouragement for her friends.  She feels very happy to be generating her own income.  She has a lot of plans in mind, but at the moment what she wants the most is to keep working.  For the future, she wants to set up a grocery store business in her home.  She wants to achieve this in the near future.  

This is Juliana's 8th loan with MFP.  She is very happy and grateful for the support that she is receiving, which will help her to gradually achieve her goals.  Also, she promises to make her payments responsibly and on time.  She appreciates belonging to her communal bank, where she is a founding member, because she knows that all of the members are responsible and supportive.

With the sum of 1,500 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will buy the fish that are most in demand in the region, so that she can continue to sell.  Her daily investment can rise as high as 1,500 soles, depending on the type of fish and the season.

loans.use: to buy the fish that are most in demand in the region so that she can continue to sell

loans.name: Tsogtbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Tsogtbayar, 47 years old, lives with his wife, daughter and niece in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife gets a disability pension from the state, and his daughter works as an organizer at a private business entity. He himself operates an auto crane and now works with a private construction business entity on contract. 

In 2004, he built his own house with planks, and in eight years, the house has deteriorated very badly and needs some serious repair. Repairing work includes but is not limited to encasing it with bricks and interior decoration. 

In this time of year, the construction materials price is at its lowest and purchasing them now will save a considerable amount of money. So he is requesting a loan of 6,800,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase construction materials such as cement, gypsum board, bricks and glass cotton, etc. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable and warm place. Also in cold periods, the family will burn less coal due to a renovated house, and a reduction of coal usage contributes to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Narmandakh

texts.en: Mr. Narmandakh is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, which is the capital city of Mongolia.
