The family resides in traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. In May of 2012, his wife rented a grocery store and the business is prospering slowly. He has been rendering taxi service to the local people for 9 consecutive years. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of food at a wholesale price. As a result, he will be able to help his wife’s grocery store business. This borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future. In the future, he wants to plant vegetables at an agricultural site and build a house on his plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of food for resale

loans.name: Leselda

texts.en:
Leselda is 36 years old and married with 4 children.

Leselda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Leselda has borrowed and paid back 14 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running her general store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling ready to wear clothing and buying and selling coconut shell.

Leselda aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Lorybel

texts.en:
Lorybel works hard to support her 2 children. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

Lorybel has requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting a solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of an emergency or a brown-out.

Lorybel is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Nanet

texts.en:
Nanet works hard to support her family. Nanet is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Nanet has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase a new fishing net and other fishing equipment.

Nanet has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Nanet would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing net and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dolores is 29 years old and has 3 children who are in school.

Dolores has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Dolores requested a PHP 29500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Dolores has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ulziitogtokh

texts.en: Mr. Ulziitogtokh, 39 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an apartment. His wife has been running a beauty salon for ten years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in this type of business. He himself has worked as a railman at a train station and, in October, 2012, he stopped working and began his taxi service business. Their daughter and son both study at a high quality mathematics school. Three years ago his wife got divorced and married him. Mr. Ulziitogtokh is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 tugriks to repair his apartment before the Mongolian traditional holiday known as White Moon. The loan will be used to purchase construction materials such glass cotton, paints, emulsion and nails. As a result, the family can greet the most special holiday with a renovated home. Updated and new things are a sign of living well for the incoming year of the White Moon holiday.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items like spices, soap, sugar, and soft drinks to sell in her general store.

Liliosa has been in this business for 17 years. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Liliosa has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save  enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items like spices, soap, sugar, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
El señor Diego no tiene hijos, vive en anticrético con su mamá ocupando una habitación con un acabado fino y piso de machimbre, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Escobar Uria de la ciudad de La Paz.

Diego, estudió hasta el nivel secundario, actualmente trabaja de forma independiente reparando celulares y también los vende en su puesto,  ya que  ayuda a su mamá con los gastos de alimentación, vestimenta y servicios básicos.

El crédito lo requiere para el incremento de su capital  para comprar repuestos de celulares, además quiere mejorar sus ingresos económicos. 

El sueño de Diego, es tener una tienda propia de celulares donde pueda hacer crecer su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.  

Es la primera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Diego has no children. He lives with his mother in a rental property that consists of a room with fine finishes and a wooden plank floor. The house is located in the District of Escobar Uria in the city of La Paz.

Diego studied through high school. He currently works independently by repairing mobile phones, but he also sells them from his vending stall. This enables him to help his mother with expenses such as food, clothing, and basic services.

The loan he is requesting will be used to increase his capital for buying mobile phone parts. He also wants to improve his financial earnings. Diego’s dream is to have his own mobile phone store where he can grow his business and eventually improve his quality of life.

This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for repairing mobile phones.

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en:
Nicodemus is a 40-year-old man who is married to Maria, a 35-year-old lady. They have been blessed with three children: Irma, 19, is a college student; Hans, 16, attends third grade of junior high school; Rianty, 7, attends second grade of elementary school. 

Nicodemus runs a poultry business. It takes a ten meters walk to reach his business place, as he did not have adequate empty space to lay the hen coop. Nicodemus started the business three months ago. 

Every three weeks, Nicodemus purchases chicks and fodder from the supplier, raises them for 28 days in order to get them to the standard weight, and then sells them directly to the regulars. Besides running this business, Nicodemus also runs a pig-breeding business; his first loan from TLM has been spent to initiate the business. 
 
Recently, Nicodemus has a plan to improve the business. He has applied for his second loan from TLM amounting to IDR 7,500,000. He would like to spend the loan on more chicks (two boxes) and the fodder. Nicodemus also wants to provide vaccine and vitamins for these chicks to ensure their health.

loans.use: to buy more chicks (two boxes), fodder, vaccine and vitamins.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
This is Nieves. She previously accessed a PHP30,000 loan that she used to buy more coffee and other products to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She now has a variety store which also helps generate income for her family.

She would like to apply for another PHP50,000 loan to buy more coffee and other related products. She will also use the money in buying grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her variety store. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nieves dreams that her businesses will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of their work. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more coffee and other related products, and grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Anci

texts.en:
Anci is a 59-year-old widow. She had two sons: one lives in another region and the other one has died. Since the death of her son, Anci takes care of her grandchildren, Yoan and William, and Ririn. The children are at school.

Anci has been running a poultry business for 10 years, starting before her husband died five years ago. She is thankful that this business enables her to finance her grandchildren's needs. Anci and her late husband initiated the business by breeding about 300 to 500 chicks but, since he died, Anci can only breed 200 chicks. Currently, Anci intends to buy 300 chicks to breed but she does not have enough money to do so. In order to improve her business, Anci requested a loan from TLM of 4,500,000 Indonesian rupiah to purchase three packages of chicks to raise and fodder.

loans.use: to purchase three packages of chicks to be raised and fodder.

loans.name: Namjildorj

texts.en:
Mr. Namjildorj is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on his relative’s plot of land. His wife stays at home to take care of their infant child. 

Mr. Namjildorj has been rendering a taxi service since 2005. This business is the only income source for the whole family. His automobile has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repairs, so he is requesting a loan of MNT1,500,000 to purchase spare parts and a motor. 

As a result, he will again render taxi service to local people using his repaired automobile. Mr. Namjildorj is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and a motor to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes. She previously accessed a PHP15,000 loan that she used to purchase quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help towards her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Her variety store has been her business for three years now. For additional income, she also sells different tidbits, dainties and sweetmeats. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another PHP15,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lourdes dreams of expanding her business and of having more customers. She hopes to have a good life with her family and that they will have a stronger bond. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 41 years old and married with 4 children. They live in the Philippines.

She earns a living by raising pigs. Susan is borrowing PHP15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Susan has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
This is Pablita. She previously accessed a 20,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan that she used to buy RTW [Ready-To-Wear] products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. Buy-and-sell has been her business for ten years now and it continues to grow. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family.

Pablita would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy different products like belts, towels, umbrellas, flashlights, hammers and other products needed in her general merchandise store. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Pablita hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and draw her family more closely to God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree is 37 years old, married, and has one child.

Desiree works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store, like shampoo and groceries. Desiree has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming and buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Jocelyn has been farming and buying and selling vegetables for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm equipment.

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru:
Вера – предприниматель из Мелитополя. Она занимается торговлей мужской и женской одеждой на местном рынке. Опыт работы составляет уже 14 лет. 
Вере понадобилась сумма в размере 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сезонный зимний товар, а именно свитера, пуловеры, толстовки, джемпера, рубашки и т.п. для последующей реализации в холодное время года.
texts.en: Vera is an entreprenur from Melitopol. She sells men's and women's clothes at the local market. She has 14 years of experience doing this type of work. Vera needs a loan in the amount of 5000 hrivna to buy seasonal winter products, namely sweater, sweatshirts, tolstovka shirts, jumpers, shirts, etc. for selling during the cold weather months.

loans.use: to buy seasonal winter products, namely sweater, sweatshirts, tolstovka shirts, jumpers, shirts

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 39 years old, married, and has six children. With five children in school, Gina must work very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a buy-and-sell bamboo business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to resell.

Gina would like to save money, to enable her to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to resell

loans.name: Zayton

texts.en:
This is Zayton, 46, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Esmael, a self-employed man, and she is a mother to their child. She and her husband manage their household, while engaging in business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Zayton operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects an increase in her business income as she enlarges her business. 

Zayton hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her child a good and quality education. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages, to increase the inventory of her store.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
This is Marceline. She previously accessed a 50,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories for her jeepney as well as pay for its maintenance. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. She has been in this business for twenty years now and they have six jeepney units. She also rents out a house for additional income.

Marceline would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance of their jeepney. Her profits from the business will definitely help meet her business and family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marceline hopes that her business will grow even more and prays for good health. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

Note: Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney – open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney.

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.en: Anselmo is married with three children. He is 46 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Anselmo owns and operates a private transportation service. He has been in this business three years and earns 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month. He requested a new loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and accessories. Anselmo been a member of Kiva's partner GDMPC since 2012. In the future, Anselmo wants to finish his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Andrei

texts.ru:
Андрей живет в селе Днепровка. Он занимается выращиванием овощей на своем участке уже 12 лет. У него есть несколько теплиц, выращивает помидоры, огурцы и редис. Андрей – очень трудолюбивый. Он работает на огороде, а в свободное время также подрабатывает сварщиком – делает теплицы для других сельскохозяйственников. 
Андрей обратился к КИВА за кредитом в размере 24 000 гривен для того, чтобы устроить отопление теплиц. Он планирует сделать газовое отопление в теплице для рассады, для этого ему нужно приобрести котел, сделать проект на газ и приобрести все нужные материалы. У Андрея есть еще земля. В планах у него построить теплицы и там, а со временем также сделать хороший ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Andrei lives in the Dneprovka village.  He has been involved in growing vegetables on his land plot for 12 years.  He has several greenhouses, where he grows tomatoes, cucumbers and radishes.  Andrei is very hardworking.  He works on the land and also as a welder in his free time, making greenhouses for other farmers.  Andrei requested a loan in the amount of 24 000 hryvnia from Kiva to install heating for greenhouses.  He plans to install gas heating in the seedling greenhouse and needs to purchase a boiler, make plans for gas and buy all of the necessary materials.  Andrei has more land.  He plans to install greenhouses there as well and make good repairs at home in time.

loans.use: to install heating in greenhouses

loans.name: Maxym

texts.ru: Максим занимается выращиванием овощей в теплицах на своем земельном участке уже 10 лет. В основном он выращивает помидоры, огурцы и редис. Максим простой и общительный, он срадостью делится тем как идут дела в его бизнесе и планами на будущее. Максиму нужны дополнительные средства для ремонта теплицы, а также покупки семян. У Максима есть еще земля, где он хочет построить еще одну теплицу. Максим женат, есть один сын, который учится в школе.
texts.en: Maxym has been involved in growing vegetables in greenhouses on his land plot for 10 years.  He mainly grows tomatoes, cucumbers and radishes.  Maxym is simple and personable; he gladly shares how his business is going and his future plans.  Maxym needs additional means to repair a greenhouse and to buy seeds.  Maxym has more land, where he wants to build another greenhouse.  Maxym is married and has a son, who attends school.

loans.use: to repair a greenhouse and buy seeds

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores, a 53-year-old, married mother of four children, is from Santa Cruz, Tangub City. There, she has been operating a general retail store, selling a variety of food and non-food products, for the past 10 years. She earns 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dolores joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She expected such services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now she is requesting a new loan of 7,500 PHP to buy more items to resell, such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store, such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила выращивает овощи в теплицах. В прошлом сезоне благодаря КИВА кредиту она получила хороший урожай и смогла благоустроить свое жилье. Однако, младшей дочери Людмилы сделали операцию на желудке. На лекарства ушло много денег, но дочери уже намного лучше. Старший сын нашел работу и теперь помогает с деньгами.

Людмила просит предоставить ей кредит на закупку качественных семян, а также замены пленки в теплице. Это позволит Людмиле вовремя приготовиться к сезону и получить хорошую прибыль.
texts.en: Ludmila grows vegetables in greenhouses.  Thanks to a Kiva loan, she gathered a good harvest last season and was able to improve her home.  Unfortunately, Ludmila's youngest daughter had a stomach surgery.  A lot of money was spent on medications, but the daughter has improved significantly.  The oldest son found work and now helps with money.  Ludmila is requesting this loan to purchase quality seeds and also to replace plastic for a greenhouse.  This will allow Ludmila to prepare for the season in a timely manner and make a good profit.

loans.use: to purchase quality seeds and also to replace plastic for a greenhouse

loans.name: Avelyn

texts.en:
This is Avelina, of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, a widow, and has two grown children. Avelina cultivates bananas and mangoes for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Avelina joined GDMPC. Avelina is requesting a loan of 11,500 PHP, which she will use to pay laborers to do work needed for 
farm maintenance. She plans to use the additional profit generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay laborers for work needed to maintain her banana and mango farm.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 61 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, Joel raises livestock for sale, primarily pigs. He has been engaged in this business for five years and earns 25,000 PHP a month. 

Joel been a member of GDMPC since 2004. He is requesting a new loan of 48,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. He aims to expand his business one day.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Лариса замужем. У нее есть взрослые дочери. Она занимается фермерством.

Лариса выращивает овощи на продажу на протяжении 25 лет. Она имеет собственный большой участок земли, засаженный кабачками, капустой, баклажанами и т.д. Лариса также выращивает рассаду и ранние овощи в телицах. Она целеустремленная и трудолюбивая. 

Лариса просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 15000 гривен на закупку удобрений, дров и семян. Часть кредита Лариса хочет потратить на ремонт теплиц. Она надеется получить дополнительную прибыль благодаря кредиту и восполнить нужны семьи.
texts.en:
Larisa is married. She has grown daughters. She works as a farmer.
Larisa has been growing vegetables for sale for some 25 years now. She has her own large land plot, where she grows vegetable marrow [a type of squash], cabbage, eggplant/aubergines etc. Larisa also  plants out seedlings and grows early-season vegetables in her greenhouses. She is goal-oriented and hard-working.

Larisa is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 UAH to buy fertilizers, firewood and seeds. She would like to use part of her loan to renovate her greenhouses. She hopes to increase her revenues thanks to this loan and to provide for household needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, firewood and seeds.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old and married. Julie plants, harvests, and sells bananas for a living. She has been engaged in this business for six years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Julie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Julie is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Aellin

texts.en:
Aellin, a 36-year-old married mother of three, is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has been operating a specialized retail ice cream business for the past two years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Aellin joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her product. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her product.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora May is from Catadman, Ozamis City. She is 33 years old, married, and has one child. To make a living, Flora May owns and operates a business serving local foods in the community. Flora May has been engaged in this business for three years and earns 22,500 PHP a month. 

Flora May is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional food and drinks to sell. She joined GDMPC in 2012 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional food and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 44 years old and married with two children. She's from Gala, Ozamis City. Susan has been operating a farming business for 15 years. She earns 20,000 PHP a month. 

In 2004, Susan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a loan of 33,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Susan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Jabeen's Group

texts.en:
Jabeen is a 48-year-old hard-working woman. She lives in Pakistan with her husband, five sons and two daughters. Both the daughters are married and the elder son has a vegetable shop. Her husband owns a small vegetable shop in the market. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Jabeen is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. 

She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Jabeen is a member of six-person group and has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch up more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is a 44-year-old married woman and the responsible mother of two sons and four daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an independent and hardworking woman. Her husband is doing a private job.

For the last 22 years, Rubina has been in the garment business. She purchases garments from different areas and sells them in the market nearby. With her little income she helps her husband to meet the family needs and the costs of their children's education. Presently Rubina needs to purchase a variety of garments for her business. For that she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Purchasing more garments will allow her to expand her business. She is hopeful that the loan will be productive for her small business and family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of garments to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 44, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gregorio, a mechanic, and she is a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their business. She is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Helen operates a variety store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling them individually. Her regular customers are her neighbors and others in the community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to help her continue to operate her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Helen dreams of seeing all of her children successful in their careers, and she also hopes to expand her business. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories about her life and her business and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy goats and sheep for an animal-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embriodery material for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 90 kg of chemical fertilizer, to rent of a field and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is from Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is 35 years old and married with two children. To make a living, she does fish vending while her husband does fishing. She has been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month for this activity. 

In 2008, Merlinda joined GDMPC. Merlinda is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Motia

texts.en: Motia is a 24-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He opened his own grocery store to earn an income. He has seven years experience in business, and he hopes his skills will help him. He is a hard worker, putting much effort into improving his family's living conditions. He applied for a youth loan of 150,000 YER to buy grocery items to increase his business. He says that his parents have been a big inspiration and that is why he will fight to offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to increase his business.

loans.name: Mufari Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nsimire, trésorière du groupe Mufari, entrepreneur courageuse et mère de 7 enfants, qui vont tous à l’école. Son conjoint est un enseignant dans une école publique. La cliente est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires, elle s’approvisionner dans l’intérieur de la province. Elle commença cette affaire avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 15 sacs de maïs. A son passage, la cliente paye trop des taxes aux groupes armés, qui opèrent dans ces zones. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son accompagnement en micro crédit aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Nsimire is treasurer for the Mufari group, a courageous entrepreneur, and mother of seven children, all of whom go to school. Her spouse is a teacher at a public school.

Nsimire sells foodstuffs. She stocks up in the countryside. She started this business with her own funds that she received from her husband. This new loan will enable her to buy 15 bags of corn.

Nsimire pays too much in taxes, when she travels, to armed groups operating in the regions where she goes. She would therefore like to thank Hekima for assisting small, non-bankable entrepreneurs by providing them micro loans. It should be noted that another client is holding her baby.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of corn

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: La Famille Group

texts.fr: Regroupant les membres d’une même famille élargie,le regroupement « la Famille  » compte 5 membres dont 4 hommes et une femme qui s’activent dans le commerce et l’aviculture. Leur président, monsieur  Mamadou Samba âgé de 54 ans, fait de l’aviculture depuis 2 ans et désire un  crédit pour renforcer et augmenter la capacité de sa production en poulets de chair. Il est marié et s’occupe de sa famille pour leur besoins journaliers en nourriture. Mamadou Samba désire avoir une autonomie financière un jour et pouvoir financer seul son activité.
texts.en: The "Famille" group is composed of five members of one extended family (four men and one woman) who are actively involved in retail business and poultry farming.  Their leader, Mamadou Samba, is 54 years old.  He has been involved in poultry farming for the past two years and wishes to obtain a loan to boost and increase his production capacity of broilers.  He is married and takes care of his family's daily nutritional needs.  Mamadou Samba wishes to be financially independent one day and to be able to finance his business by himself.

loans.use: to buy young chickens to raise and resell.

loans.name: Keneth

texts.en:
Kenneth lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. His primary income sources are milk, eggs,  and crops and has been doing this work for five years. He has one child.

He stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is the "time for harvesting after months of hard work". His biggest challenge is managing costs. He will use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

Kenneth was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'because it is a social organization.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. He answered, 'co-guarantee mechanism.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Kenneth replied 'better quality of life.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Kenneth owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity' but does not have 'solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is 35 years old, married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Cristy manages and owns a business, raising crab and shrimp for sale to earn a living. She has been in business for 5 years and she earns PHP 6,000 each month. She is requesting a loan of PHP 11,500 to purchase additional crabs and shrimp. Cristy's business is very stable in her community. 

She joined GDMPC last year. In the future she will use her income to support her two children in their studies until they finish college. She also provides their daily needs. Cristy hopes that her business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs and shrimp

loans.name: Dilsia Rosa

texts.es: Dilsia, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara junto a uno de sus hijos. Ella inicio su propio negocio de pulpería hace 4 años donde vende maíz, frijoles, manteca, churros, café, azúcar, condimentos, huevos, verduras, pastillas, refrescos, pollo, etc. este negocio es su fuente de ingresos.  Doña Dilsia   ha mantenido activo el negocio mediante la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente esta solicitando el sexto préstamo que es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir también en la compra de productos básicos alimenticios como maíz, frijol, arroz, azúcar, manteca, pollo, churros, refrescos, y otros abarrotes para surtir el negocio. Su objetivo es incrementar el inventario y ofrecer más producto a los clientes. Ella tiene como meta llegar a ser un supermercado y que sea un patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dilsia is a 49-year-old single mother who has four children. She lives in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara, with one of her children.

Dilsia established her own grocery business four years ago. There she sells corn, beans, lard, snack foods, coffee, sugar, condiments, eggs, vegetables, medicines, soft drinks, chicken, and other items. This business serves as her source of income. Doña Dilsia has maintained an active business by investing several loans.

She is currently requesting her sixth loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that she can invest in the purchase of basic food products such as corn, beans, rice, sugar, lard, chicken, snacks, soft drinks, and other grocery items to restock her business. Her objective is to increase her inventory so that she can offer more products to her customers. She also has a goal of converting her business into a supermarket so that she can provide an inheritance for her children.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, sugar, lard, chicken, snacks, soft drinks, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
El señora Adela tiene dos hijos, vive en casa familiar, ocupando una habitación y sus dependencias como ser: baño, cocina, comedor y sala con un acabado fino y piso de machimbre, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz.

Adela, estudió hasta el nivel secundario, actualmente se dedica a la venta de cortes de telas de todo tipo como ser: telas para la confección de polleras, poleras, mantas, blusas y otros, ella vende por más de doce horas al día ya que es su única fuente de ingresos. 

El crédito lo requiere para el incremento de su capital, desea comprar más material prima (telas) para surtir su negocio y mostrar la variedad de telas a sus clientes. 

El sueño de Adela, es tener una tienda propia y hacer crecer su negocio.

Es la primera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Adela has two children. She and her family live in a house that includes a bathroom, kitchen, dining room, and living room with fine finishes and wooden plank floors. The house is located in the District of Miraflores in the city of La Paz.

Adela studied through high school. She currently sells all types of cut fabric that is used for making skirts, T-shirts, blankets, blouses, and other articles. Adela works more than 12 hours a day and this business is her only source of income.

The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital. She wants to buy more fabrics so that she can restock her business and display a variety of materials for her customers. Her dream is to have her own shop and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Appolinaire

texts.fr: Appolinaire est un homme de 43 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. il a ouvert un mini kiosque dans un quartier de la ville qu'il gère depuis 03 ans et se debrouille bien. Il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des produits alimentaires telles que biscuits, bonbons, cacahuète et cigarettes, etc... afin d'augmenter son stock de marchandises. Ce qui permettra de réaliser un bénéfice non seulement pour augmenter son capital et activité et de satisfaire la clientèle. Il voudrait ainsi avec ces derniers pouvoir subvenir au besoin de sa femme et de ses 04 enfants.
texts.en: Appolinaire is a 43-year-old man who is married and the father of four children.  He has opened a small booth in one of the city's neighborhoods and he has been running it for three years.  He is managing well.  He is requesting this loan to buy goods such as biscuits, candy, peanuts, cigarettes etc...and increase his stock of products.  This will allow him to make a profit, which will be used to increase his capital, expand his activity, and meet his customers' needs.  In doing so, he hopes to be able to meet the needs of his wife and four children.

loans.use: to buy goods such as biscuits, candy, peanuts, cigarettes etc...

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es: Vilma, tiene 40 años de edad, esta divorciada, tiene 5 hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de San Francisco Atlántida. Ella tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa nueva como blusas, camisas, pantalones, vestidos y ropa para niños. Ademas vende cosméticos y achinería. El negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa y ya tiene su clientela fija. Vilma a decidido solicitar un préstamo de 12,000 Lempiras para compra de más mercadería y mantener surtido su negocio, con esta inversión ella espera obtener más utilidades. Tiene como meta trabajar duro para que crezca el negocio y que nunca les falte la alimentación y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Vilma is 40 years old, divorced, and has five children. She lives in a neighborhood in the town of San Francisco Atlántida.

For the past four years, Vilma has been selling new clothing such as blouses, shirts, trousers, dresses, and children’s outfits. She also sells cosmetics and knickknacks. Her business is located in her house and she has an established clientele.

Vilma decided to request a loan in the amount of 12,000 HNL so that she can buy more merchandise to maintain the inventory in her business. She hopes this investment will result in more profits. Her goal is to work hard so that she can grow her business and provide food and an education for her children.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Poh Gending Lestari Group

texts.en:
Ni Nengah and the whole group of Poh Gending Lestari got a second loan from MUK. After evaluating the first loan, the group wanted to get additional funding from MUK to supplement their pigs.

Ni Nengah has a plan to use the loan to buy a sow and feed purchased with her own capital. Ni Nengah lives with her husband, who works as a private employee, and one of her children who is still in senior high school. Every day she spends 30,000 IDR for groceries, 20,000 IDR to equip her schoolchild and 125,000 IDR to pay for electricity and water. She hopes the sow can give her a lot of healthy piglets.

loans.use: To buy a sow
